text: I'd give this place 3 1/2 stars if I could. Because to me, this place isn't blow your socks off delicious! Instead it's just good enough.   Look, when I'm craving pho I'm glad I have a place close by to order from, however it's just not as good as I'm used to back home. I think my problem is it doesn't taste as authentic as I'm used to. This place to me seems like it's trying to be asian fusion (like Pei Wei or PF Changs) when I just want pho nothing fancy just pho.  Though I did think the spring rolls were awesome!!!  But nonetheless it does fulfil my cravings without me having to drive 45 minutes, so I'm happy about that!
Visited a couple of times over the last 2 years because it's close to home. The food is  okay  but on the expensive side. Service seems disorganized but I never had bad treatment.

We take the family here all the time. This restaurant is one of the best on this side of town. Usually crowded, fresh ingredients. Kids like the garlic noodles but I always get the filet mignon pho with lots of grandmas special peppers (you have to ask for them!).

Our first trip but definitely not our last!  My husband & I picked this destination after watching the food review show Check Please on PBS. We were not disappointed! We started with an icy Suprise Sangria which was exactly what we needed after a long week. Then ordered the Filet mignon shaken beef served with a fresh green salad with a tasty vinaigrette dressing. Dessert was bananas foster with salted caramel ice cream which we split. Fabulous!  Dennis, the owner, was on site and we told him how comfortable and inviting his restaurant is. The hostesses, waiters, and staff were professional and very courteous. We were treated wonderfully from the minute we walked in to the minute we walked out. We will be back to Saigon Kitchen again and will tell our friends to go as well.
Wanted to try something new so we went to dinner here.....overall, it was an average meal meaning it lacked flavor, very bland. Portions were on the small side but prices were fair!

Beautiful restaurant and wonderful food.  I have had appetizers for my meal because the portions are such a great size.  I have enjoyed many things on their menu and thought they were excellent!  This is a place my mom and I frequent.  It's a 10 in my book!
I had the combination pho which was ok. I liked the cleanness of the place although price is a little high.

The expansion looks great.  We enjoyed some new items that I hope to see on the menu- a combination crispy/spring roll, Siagon stir-fry and fabulous lamb chops.  Can't wait to have them again.  Plus, my stand-by items- firecracker shrimp or the shaken beef are terrific.  But if I stop n for lunch, it's the Dennis sandwich for me!

I would have never gone to this place had it not been for yelp! This place is a hidden gem! I come here about once a week. I have ordered a wide variety of things here and I'm happy to report that I've yet to be disappointed.       Appetizer: their spring rolls are a must have. My friends love the shrimp one will I love their tofu ones. They sear the tofu making it firm and hefty so it's not some mushy mess like other places. Their peanut sauce is devine but a server gave us an awesome tip bc my friend has a peanut allergy, ask for the chili sauce or aoili sauce to dip them in. Best tip ever. Their Thai tea, coconut water, and jasmine green tea are so refreshing!       Pho. I've had the chicken, beef, shrimp, and veggie (I told you I'm a regular!) and they are all great. It's such a comforting soup and I crave it all the time. Their veggie one is particular amazing bc they cook their veggies to where they're a bit tender yet still have some crunch, the leeks in particular. They use fresh ingredients from Lee Lee's Market. Their Saigon noodles are delicious as well as their shaken beef and shrimp plate. I'm not typically a fan of rice vermicelli but my plate here was ok, not bad or good just ok. Their lemongrass chicken here made me a fan. I've been to other places and this place has the best.       Pricing and service. Ppl say it's a bit pricier than they would like but honestly it's not even that expensive. The pricing is similar to that of an Applebee's or other mid-level chain restaurant but the food is 100x better. I choose to support local businesses as much as possible anyways.             Service: speedy and friendly. I've never had an issue. Even when they're jam packed (snow bird season and lunch time) the servers always come by and check in on our table. Sometimes if I'm feeling anti-social or getting out from work late I just order it for pickup and it's usually ready within 10-15 mins (always the tofu spring rolls and veggie pho). I've gotten my parents, sis, and a few friends hooked on this place, even those that typically don't like Asian/Vietnamese food.

We are in town visiting family and last night's dinner was a meal at Saigon Kitchen. We were told that it might be crowded, as SK it a popular place serving very good food. I guess we got there right before the dinner rush as we we able to score a 'high seat' table right away. Timing was good because right after we sat down, every seat in the place filled up with hungry diners. The staff was friendly and in spite of the number of people seated, our orders were taken in a timely manner. Drinks and appetizers came out in good time too. For appetizers the four of us shared an order of Cahn Ga Chein Bo - Garlic Butter Wings and Goi Cuon - Spring Rolls. The wings were very good. Yes, I know, wings are tough to mess up but the meat was juicy and the skin was crispy - perfect combination. The spring rolls  were over stuffed with very fresh ingredients, soft roll with crunchy filling is the way to go. The peanut sauce was smooth and delicious. We also had a small bowl of the duck sauce, which had slivered carrots and onion, perfect dipping sauce. For my main dish I ordered the Com Dac Beit - Combination Rice Plate. This was Charbroiled Pork, Grilled Pork Chop & Charbroiled Shrimp over jasmine rice. Again, each protein was cooked just the way it should be and delicious as could be. This was served with scallion soup and a fresh salad. Having gone into Saigon Kitchen with no idea of what to expect, I left after enjoying wonderful meal which was both delicious and satisfying. When back in Surprise, AZ I will definitely be heading back to SK for another great meal.

This was not a great experience.   We waited at least 3-5 minutes before anyone came out of the kitchen to the counter to take our order.  We placed our order and took a seat.   We waited more than 10 minutes for our drinks.  The summer rolls (spring rolls Vietnamese style) were subpar.   They tasted fishy, we're not rolled tight and the peanut sauce was bland and did not have peanuts in it.  The beef pho was ok.  It was warm but pretty bland.   However it was the perfect size.  Not too much, not too little.  Overall not a good experience.  Food wasn't that great and the service was les than desired.  I doubt we will be going back.

I only ever get the shaken beef here and so does my wife because it is what I like, and it's that good.  It doesn't get any better than beef, rice, and sauteed onions for me and I could eat this every day, if my arteries would let me.  I have tried other dishes when I have eaten here with family and friends and the consensus is that the other fare is excellent as well!  My kids love the salmon and so did my mother.  I'm getting hungry for this place right now...

First n last, price is so high for Vietnamese food, customers service is horrible, food taste so plain, I order pho n so disappointed. Staff act like I don't exist. Places is clean but I won't come back cuz food suck n staff are rude!!!

1 star for great service Very pricey pho, servings are small, flavors are not there either.  Generally I can add in all the fixings and get an awesome bowl of noodles, but this time it was quite disappointing.  Not sure what they are doing, but we will not be trying to figure it out.

The banh mi and pho are really good, as some people say the raw meat is separate when you get takeout. Just heat your broth and assemble it as soon as you get home.  The different egg rolls are some of the best i have had, they are super fresh and always good.
Decent Pho nothing to write home about. Not a lot of depth in the broth. Still good though. However, their crispy egg rolls are on point.
We were a large party and the staff was amazing.  I will definitely visit the Saigon Kitchen again.
Fun place to eat. Great bar. Best vodka martinis in west valley.

I will start by saying the food here was delicious (I had sweet potato fries, crispy egg rolls and wings with house sauce and Sriracha). Again, the food was delicious....until I found an insect on the lettuce that came with my crispy egg rolls. Of course this turned my stomach and I completely lost my appetite. I returned all of the food to the server and didn't make a big deal about it. That is until I was informed that because I ate 3 of the wings and some of the fries, I would still be charged for the meal, per the "owner's policy."  I don't know of any person who could complete their meal after finding a bug in their food. The manager came to speak with me and informed that he took the charge off for the egg rolls but will still charge me for the fries and wings. Ummm, NO!!  I sent the food back not because I didn't like it, I didn't like the bug on my flipping plate!!!  The manager yet again informed me of the "owner's policy" and refused to side with me, the customer. After a few minutes of "back and forth" with me, he did however agree to take the charge for the fries off as well. Since I originally sent the wings back, and they still were going to charge me for them, I requested they make me another batch. Long story short, it's pretty sad that the "owner" would risk losing potential customers over this. He should be more concerned about keeping insects out of his foods. Needless to say, I will NEVER come back to this place again.

The service was great. The food however, had some major flaws. I got the combo Pho and there was nothing but fat intend of steak; also found a hair in mouth my after taking a scoop of soup. Upon finishing, my girlfriends chicken Pho also had a hair strand. Will not go back again for those reasons.

THE BEST VIETNAMESE I HAVE EVER HAD! You got to try this little family joint with, by god the best egg rolls ever. I usually get the  Shaken Beef, a tender, well seasoned, beef plate with onions, and rice. Though my experiences there I have gotten the Saigon Fried Rice, a wonderful, sausage, shrimp, and chicken meal is awesome! This place is HIGHLY recommended.

My husband and I eat there frequently and have enjoyed every meal. I usually start with the spring rolls or skewers. Their Pho soups are delicious, well flavored and full of stock. The staff is very friendly and we are so glad that they extended their space.

Have read reviews. Including some of the negative  ones. I/we have been going there regularly ,ever since it opened.  We have never had any issues with ,bugs. Hairs etc.  In fact the owner seems to be  concerned about quality and actively solicits the customers input. We have eaten at many other Vietnam style resturants, S.K is in the top tier.

I'm so happy I have a place for pho close to me! The viet summer rolls were delicious too with fresh  herbs and clean shrimp! My pho had a nice broth, thin rare meat, and a plate of fresh toppings to put in. I thoroughly enjoyed it! The owner or only woman that was there was extremely friendly and loved my toddler which is a plus with me!  I only wish it was bigger like more of a restaurant rather a sit in fast food place. But please check it out, it needs to stay in business,  Also hubby had beef and broccoli which was very good as well, not your typical greasy Chinese.

Tonight was the second time we dined at Saigon Kitchen.  It will be the last time.  There were four of us; our meals came out one at a time, with several minutes between.  One of us ordered barbequed short ribs.  They were so tough, they were inedible.  When we told our server we didn't think the beef was short rib beef, he responded "Is the meat tough?"  One of us ordered lemongrass chicken; nowhere in the description did it say "contains seeds," and yes, it did.  The place was busy and they couldn't care less than not one of the four of us will be back.

Nice place. Clean and modern, simplistic decor. Only giving four rather than five stars because the vegetarian pho was made with chicken broth. I was really looking forward to a big bowl of yummy pho, but last time I checked vegetarians don't eat chicken. The waiter, however, was super nice and I appreciate that he told me about the broth before I ordered and he helped me find something I could eat instead. (I had a rice vermicelli bowl w/o fish sauce instead -yum!) Great, small local beer selection and good happy hour prices. Didn't sit on the patio, but it looked nice especially for the cooler AZ days. Try to sit near the front of the restaurant if you don't want to be near the dish bussing station.
My favorite restaurant Vietnamese restaurant in Surprise. The staffs and the owner are super nice and accommodating. I love the pho and i get this all the time.
Pho is very good.  If you like Pho, try their cucumber salad and chicken & rice soup combo.  Excellent!  Service is very helpful if you need ideas.
Surf & Turf Shaken Beef is worth the stop in!!  The pho was flavorful and complex like it should be.  Even the broth served with the entree was great!

Amazingly delicious and fresh food! Pho an spring rolls (I had shrimp only) hit the spot - I an from the San Francisco Bay Area and have been looking got good Pho here in the valley and THIS IS IT!!!! Thank you SK for opening out here in the west. You saved me :) So excited to have many more dishes.  *Note: they have an awesome bar menu too.

This place amazed us.  While its not exactly my style of food, the wife and I have been looking to try different things. After reading the reviews here, we were sold and had high expectations.  Saigon Kitchen did not disappoint.  Actually we were blown away.  Everything we ordered, appetizers, beer &and dinner entrees had AMAZING flavor and quality.  I told my wife that the charbroiled shrimp was the best shrimp I've ever tasted....ever. The service was awesome and the atmosphere was enjoyable and fun.  I'm happy we found this place

This restaurant deserves a full five stars because of the service they provide and the fresh food that they make. As a business owner I can tell what place has the most authentic Vietnamese food and Saigon Kitchen makes it authentic ladies and gentlemen!!

Everything I've eaten here is outstanding. My fallback/addiction is the shaken beef. It is so delicious. I traveled for work to Phoenix for three weeks and had shaken beef about 10 times. The customer service is very reliable and wait times for food are fairly short depending on the number of customers. Spring rolls and egg rolls are very good. My Saigon Kitchen sidekick loved the Vietnamese ribs. If you like Thai food, or a lighter version of chinese food, then dont be afraid to give this place a shot. I will eat here EVERY TIME i come to Phoenix, no question.
Good until about 12 hours later when you spend the next day blowing up from both ends from food poisoning.  PT noodles in Goodyear is much much better....
Great food, good prices, nice environment. I had the vegetarian Pho and loved it, my father really likes the place too, I recommend it to anyone, you wont be disappointed :)

Love coming here. The staff is super friendly. Great food, my favorite is the garlic noddles. Love how wheaten your dining in or taking out you can hop up to the sat to get a beer or drink while waiting for your food. Keep up the great work. Will be back!!

Outstanding. We showed up at 11:30am & the place was empty. By the time we left nearly every seat was filled.  We had the Chicken Sandwich and the Rice Plate with Pork. The sandwich was so big that I took half home & the Rice Plate was so big that my friend who'd ordered it, a husky guy, couldn't finish his either. Both dishes had beautiful presentation. I also had the Vietnamese Iced Coffee and it was yummy. Will definitely go again.

This review is strictly for the banh mi sandwiches.  I was really hoping that they would be delicious as this is the only place in the area that serves them but I would say they were just average at best.  I tried the pork and grilled chicken banh mi's (i preferred the chicken).  The veggies did not even taste pickled which I feel is the signature part of the sandwich.  They were also missing fresh jalapenos!

By far, my favorite local spot to eat. Great tasting food, casual and friendly environment. Foods are freshly prepared, great presentation and tasted ummm believably good! Perhaps, most surprising are the prices--quality and quantity of food---far exceeds cost. I'm a hungry man and I can assure you--you will get your monies worth!  My favorite dish thus far is the Shaken Beef, followed by salmon and Cornish hen.   Great location if you live in the area, plenty of parking, personal staff---Owner pride.  If memory serves me correctly, most meals cost are between 8-12 dollars per person.

This was not my type, it was lacking the flavors I'm use to with Vietnamese noodles.   Its nice inside, plating is nice, servers are nice...come for that, but for really good pho, I have better options.

I am so glad this place opened in Surprise! My mom and I went to Saigon Kitchen for lunch and this place is very good! The prices are great and the waiter is very friendly. We had the pork spring rolls which were super light and fresh. My mom had the chicken curry and I had the short ribs. Both were excellent. They give you scallion broth, rice, and salad to go with the entree. The portions were just right. This place is great and I will definitely come back for more.
The food and the service were both great. Thank you  The happy hour was fun. The wings were amazing
I go here to enjoy the Combination Pho'. I come visit at least once a week. Now that they have expanded, I am hoping that the quality stays the same.

My wife and I are new to the area, and we read this place had good reviews, so we decided to try it. We absolutely loved it , we received great service, a product made fresh to order with great  presentation and quality. Taste was perfect on all the dishes we ordered. Reasonable pricing, friendly people and great service. Also, we chatted with others there and learned they have great repeat customer base, we definitely will be revisiting.

Love it!  I ordered something with salmon and onions and it was delicious!  Also the spring rolls were excellent.   The water that comes with your meal tasted like tap water though.  I was going to ask about that but the owner/manager seemed really busy.  I wonder why they didn't give customers water to drink from the filtered water at the soda fountain machine and this would be the reason for the four star review.

Been here twice and tried the rice plates.  Food is delicious and meat was marinated with really good flavor.  Everything on the plate was tasty, good portions, good prices, very good service.  The restaurant is decorated nicely.  Enjoyed my meal and would come again.

This is the first time I've tried Vietnamese food so we picked Saigon Kitchen, and we weren't disappointed.  I wasn't sure what to order so I asked our server (Evelyn) and she suggested the Shaken Beef.  My wife doesn't care for rice so she ordered the Pork Stir Fry. Both dishes were terrific. All-in-all I couldn't have asked for more. The atmosphere is great, the service  and server were excellent, and I already mentioned the food. Advice: Try it, you'll like it.

Stopped by for lunch a few weeks back.  My girlfriend and I ordered some apps for lunch to see how this place stacked up to other Vietnamese style places.  All in all not bad at all.  My only issue was the gristly meat they used.  Im a texture guy and I gotta say gristle makes me cringe.  Maybe a anomaly bad cut.

Worst experience I've had at this restaurant. I can deal with higher than average prices; but when I'm treated rudely by the staff I will never come back! Check out my reviews, I rarely if ever give a bad review. Oh, and the owner? No customer skills whatsoever.
Sadly, this restaurant has closed. On the bright side however, a donut shop has opened in its place!
The Shaken Beef was out of this world !  Can't wait to go back again and again ! Trendy, quaint atmosphere. So happy to have something other than a chain restaurant here in Surprise !

Visited here in December 2016 per choice of family member. We got a plate of summer rolls (not fried) for the table of five people. We were hungry and were wolfing them down. Initially, I couldn't place why they didn't taste right...then I realized it --no mint. I said something to everyone at the table as we were finishing. We agreed--mint was missing and that is why they tasted bland. --We told the manager, and he looked at us like we were nuts as the summer rolls were gone. He also said he checked with the kitchen and they said they had put mint in there. (Um...no....none of us tasted it. He said maybe it was so small an amount we missed it. I think the kitchen was blowing smoke at him. I also think if it was so small an amount that all five of us missed it, there wasn't enough in there.) He said next time, to tell him right away if something was missing. My sister told him it wasn't her/our job to oversee his kitchen. (Who wants to deal with sending food back? I just want it right --the first time.)  My pho with filet mignon was meh. Tough steak. Minimal bean sprouts, basil, etc., served with it.   Three folks that ordered the Vietnamese sandwich really liked it.   My sister was underwhelmed by the clay pot dish (I liked my pho better than that).  Vietnamese food is about herbs, spices, and fresh, delightful tastes... Saigon Kitchen just doesn't seem to get the details right for me.  Overall, per prior experience with frozen vegetables (cubed carrots and peas), and meh food, I just can't recommend this place. Makes me sad as it is near my house. I feel like they ought to get the food preparation right. How hard is it?

Quickly seated at 7:30 on a Thursday night.  Interior is mellow and modern, table was clean. Smelled amazing. Menu was very enticing -- we found it hard to choose. Server gave recommendations, which we took, and we enjoyed our meals immensely: firecracker shrimp and salmon on carmelized onions.  Side salads were fresh and the vinaigrette fantastic.  The broth served with my husband's salmon had a floral essence -- lemongrass? Lavender?  Amazing flavor for a broth. Young wait staff was friendly but a bit eager to remove plates we weren't done with, get us our check before we were ready.  Why the rush?  Plenty of tables were open when we were eating at 8 and I hate to feel rushed.

I love this place already and it's only my first time here!! Food is authentic and delicious and a good portion. The bubble tea is wonderful on a hot day. The owner is a sweetheart, like a mom away from home. I definitely want to come back for bubble tea every week!!
Very nice atmosphere. Fancy dishes and great service.

I wish I could recommend eating here, as the food was above average.  Unfortunately, the service was sub-par.  We arrived at around 6pm and the place was pretty busy.  We were told it would be about 30-45 minutes for a table, we were ok with waiting for that period of time. After about 25 minutes or so we advised the hostess we would also be willing to sit outside as we saw a few empty tables on the patio, after doing so, the hostess proceeded to sit a 6 top table on the patio that showed up without a reservation and placed their name on the list about 20 minutes after us. Finally being seated around 6:50  we proceeded to look over the menu and ordered about 15 minutes later. After ordering our food we did not see or hear from any wait staff for about 30 minutes, about 3-4 other tables had been sat after us, and the restaurant had mostly cleared out. Finally at 8pm we received our salad and scallion soup, along with the tables that had arrived about 10 minutes earlier.  I asked our server how long it would be for our entrees and the response was that it would be out in a couple minutes.  I received my entree, but my partner had to wait about 10 minutes longer to receiver hers. Other tables that had arrived 15 minutes prior to that were also receiving their food at that time.   At this point I asked the server if I could please speak to the manager. The manager arrived about 5 minutes later.  I spoke with him about our experience in the restaurant and was merely given excuses.    He apologized that the hostess was new and was in training (not sure why she was working alone then).    He apologized for the wait time for our food and said that it was because the kitchen was backed up. From the point we had ordered, we only saw food delivered to maybe 4 tables. With this in mind, it took an HOUR to cook a piece of salmon, 5 shrimp and about 4 ounces of steak.  When I asked why I had received my food but my dates food arrived 10 minutes later, he said that they do not have heat lamps in the back and they bring out food as it is ready.  So my food got cold,as I waited for my dates food to be brought out.    At this point the manager offered us a free desert, which we advised that we were not interested in, and nothing else. Had I felt that my business was wanted and appreciated, I would have given Saigon Kitchen another shot, but with the poor customer service I will not recommend Saigon Kitchen to anyone.

Told our (helpful and friendly) waiter today that we have never been disappointed in many visits to Saigon Kitchen.  The staff is very engaged and wants you to find a meal that you will enjoy.  Great balance of traditional Vietnamese dishes and also some creative new ideas from other Asian countries.  I ate a massive bowl of pho and wished that there was a second helping on its way when I was done!
Outstanding food & service.  Had the Vietnamese Spring Rolls (Delicious), Avocado Egg Rolls, & Papaya Salad (Absolute Best).  Highly recommend all 3 dishes.

Came here a few months ago and forgot to review. So here is a review of what I remember. The server was fantastic and energetic. The highly recommended garlic noodles were dry and sort of gross. The rest of the meal was typical good asian food.   The only reason we havent been back is because it tastes just like normal pei wei or panda express, therefore not worth the wait/ tip/ expense.

Hmmm, we had the spring rolls and rice vermicelli with pork. None of it was bad, but not that good either. Portions were small relative to other Vietnamese restaurants I have been to. The spring rolls had only 1 or 2 shrimp in them and the peanut dipping sauce was watery and bland. The main course was almost all lettuce with little meat or other garnishes. I will not return.

We stopped in for lunch today and had the vegetarian pho, veggie spring rolls, veggie egg rolls and garlic noodles.   The veggie egg rolls were perfect, but I don't think I'd bother with the spring rolls.  They lacked any distinctive flavor.  Not bad, but nothing that made my mouth sing, either.    The pho was, as others have noted, somewhat on the bland side, but I blame the vegetarian-ized broth.  I'm no pho expert, but it had simple, clean flavors, which weren't overpowered by too much saltiness.  The garlic noodles were slightly sweet and not overly oily, but the side order portion was plenty to share, especially with having noodles in the pho.  Service was fine and we were in and out in under an hour.  We'll be back to try some of the other menu items.

This is my 3rd time visiting this place. On my first 2 visits here I thought the food was fantastic.  This time it was very disappointing.  We had the Caramelized Salmon ($14), Vietnamese ribs ($15)and Crispy Shrimp Rolls (5 Pieces for $8).  The Crispy Shrimp rolls are not worth the price.  The rolls are so small and you could barely taste the shrimp in it.  I thought the Caramelized Salmon was a bad idea.  The Vietnamese Ribs were dry and portions of it were burnt.  I'm not sure I will be returning.  I noticed that the prices have increased since my last visit.  So on the positive side, the service was excellent.

I like this place a lot. Cute little patio and good food. Servers are always friendly and attentive. I haven't tired a lot of the menu but I usually stick with shrimp fried rice or vegetable pho. Their Vietnamese coffee is my favorite-I get one every time!

Let's start with the positives, banh mi and banh xeo were great. The other three dishes we got to sample, not too flavorful. Perhaps because we went at 2:30 pm and it's an off time (still no excuse) but the entrée dishes were bland with only 4-5 pieces of meat. Can I get some meat in flavorless sauce with my rice? Shesh.    Perhaps they should just specialize on banh mi sandwiches. We'll make the drive into town and continue going to Central for better Vietnamese food.
This place had great food and even better service. I'll be going back very soon.
Love this place great food and fast service and really close by my home!!

This place is over priced and the portion is sooo small.  It's not even enough to fill you up. The seasoning was off.  Certain dishes were too salty and others were very bland. I definitely would not recommend this place or go back to it.

First time here. Nice interior and pleasant servers. Seated immediately. Ordered Garlic Noodles. One with chicken and one with shrimp. Kind of pricey ($14.00 each) but saw that it came with house salad, Jasmine rice and a broth/soup. Noodles, as we ordered, came out first. Exceptionally good and very filling, especially for lunch. Waiter brought us the bill and behold, still $14.00 with NO salad, rice or soup. I asked when he brought back our receipt, "wasn't there supposed to be a salad, rice and a soup included?" He stated that they were expanding into the shop next door (formerly Cold Stone Creamery) and they were using the menus that they were going to use when they finished the expansion. Since they were still rather small they don't as of yet include what is on the menu with each order (EVEN THO IT IS PRINTED IN BLACK AND WHITE). All we got was a "sorry for the inconvenience". Will be checking with whoever is in charge of restaurants in the state of Arizona to see if that is deceptive advertising or any form of outright fraud since we were not informed when given our menus, or our orders were taken, that we would not be getting what we thought we were ordering. Have not decided if we would be back or not.
My family and I love this little gem! The food is absolutely fantastic and never disappoints. The servers are amazing, ask for Kathy to be your waitress though, she's wonderful!

I decided to try this place after a co-worker recommended it. Where do I start:  Customer service was phenomenal. I walked in and was greeted by the friendly waiter. My tuckus had barely hit the seat before I was offered drinks. It was the first time my friend and I had visited so we didn't know what we wanted. We took a while to view the menu, but as soon as one of the staff saw us put them down he came right over and took our order.   Together we ordered the crispy egg rolls (I've renamed them heaven egg rolls), house chicken wings and fried rice. If you couldn't tell by my nickname of the egg rolls, I'll spell it out for you. They were DELICIOUS!!!! The wings were great too, crispy and with just enough sauce, my friend said she'd never cleaned a wing like that before lol. Rice was good too. Overall very satisfied with my lunch today and I will definitely be visiting that place again.
Loved Saigon Kitchen...clean, friendly efficient staff, and amazing foood! Try the Spring rolls they are amazing!  Can't wait to go back again!

I have been here I think a dozen times now, maybe more, and have never ever gotten anything that wasn't amazingly good. Camelized salmon, garlic beef noodles, lemongrass chicken, pho.....it's all really good, but expensive! Oh, and don't forget the crispy eggrolls! They are probably one of the best things they have there, they are amazing ($5 for 4). Most of the dishes are $10-$12, the pho is good, not great, and is pricey at $9 for a large. It is a really modern type atmosphere with a nice bar. I think a lot of the price is paying for that. Summing it up: great food, high prices!
Had Saigon fried rice on Saturday night very disappointed peas and carrots obviously frozen as they were still cold when served and the fried rice was very sweet.
This place is hidden diamond in Surprise. Wonderful staff, the food is always fresh. I have tried a few things off the menu and I have not been disappointed.

Seigon Kitchen is an excellent place to eat. All the food is wonderful especially the sizzling cake.They make the best fish sauce I have ever tasted. I am always telling the very nice lady that she should bottle it. Great food and the nicest people you could ever meet. Go! Enjoy!

Perhaps I got the wrong thing, but the Pho was plain gross. I have a very long commute from Surprise to Scottsdale. There happens to be a kick ass Pho joint by my work "Noodles Ranch". I was so happy when Saigon Kitchen opened, but it was not very good at all, and it was rather expensive for the product. I might give it another shot and try something different, but in my first visit I was not impressed. The atmosphere was a little weird, but the decoration and general mood was pretty cool.
Fantastic, as usual!!! The new Avocado Spring Rolls were delicious. Can't wait to have them again!! The owners are awesome, as well!!

What a great local fusion restaurant. Love the firecracker shrimp and lamb and pork specialty dishes. Garlic noodles are excellent. Appetizers are all good and a real bargain if you get there before six. Prices are reasonable, especially given the quality. Service is attentive.

Been here several times and this place is downright bomb! The atmosphere is casual and service is always on point. The pho is truly addictive. House wing sauce definitely qualifies as amazing in my book. Haven't gotten the courage up yet to try the drunken lychee fruit but I'm working on it.

This was an excellent restaurant for West Phoenix suburbs. It is not a white table cloth restaurant but the food is very good. I had the Spring rolls and Lemon grass chicken which was very spicy but wonderful flavor. Definitely try it out.

Saigon Kitchen is a very good restaurant with very personable service. The food from the appetizers to main courses are fantastic. My family looks forward to having many meals to come at this little jewel.

Not bad by any means but not great either. Spring roles were absolutely terrible but the pho tai and shrimp curry were excellent. The reason my rating isn't higher is because of the slow service. It took forever to get our drinks (not to mention even longer for a refill), our food and our check. The server was very friendly but we waited 30 minutes longer then we should have. I'll get food here again to go but never dine in.

As usual, we had a FABULOUS experience here!  We brought some "newbies" to Saigon kitchen and they had nothing but wonderful things to say!  My friends had the pho, shaken beef, and the short ribs, and I had my usual beef salad.  Super yummy!!!!  The staff is very friendly and always available if needed.  I remarked to one of my friends that they kept filling her glass while she was taking her last sip!  As always, I had the vietnamese iced coffee, which is a MUST!  So delicious!

I ordered for pick up today because I went on my lunch break. I ordered the vermicelli pork and egg roll salad Bun Thit Nuong, I get to my office and can't wait to eat my favorite dish! I was very upset that the main ingredient, the fish sauce mix was not in the container!! Now I just spent $14.50 for a meal that is incomplete. I called back to let hem know my disappointment, and all the girl could do was say sorry! That's it!! Didn't even ask how they could fix this! Now as I eat my plain, dry salad, I am even more disappointed! I can't knock the food, because it is wonderful, but the two stars are for the lack of customer service! Guess that's the risk you take when you order take out!

We enjoyed a pleasant meal here. Service was prompt and friendly.   Seating was relatively comfortable. We had a table not a booth - the latter looked more comfortable.  This is more a "fusion" restaurant rather than traditional Vietnamese. Not a problem; just an observation.  We asked for suggestions from our server. She recommended the Filet Mignon Shaken Beef which came with soup and rice and Firecracker Shrimp w/Garlic Noodles. These are two of their best selling entrees. We had an order of shrimp and pork Spring Rolls to start. Everything was tasty.   They offered interesting local and regional beers. We chose two and enjoyed them (sorry, forgot what they were).  Nice surprise in Surprise.

This place is absolutely phenomenal!  Started with chicken spring rolls, filet with rice and the banana dessert!  The restaurant was clean the service was awesome and it had a steady stream of customers,  we will be regulars!
Great food, great service. I ordered the Saigon Fried Rice and it was amazing. The staff was great, three different waiters were helping us and everything went smoothly.

Just had dinner very good food service was very good and friendly. We had lemongrass shrimp and beef pho soup. Will return to try more of the menu. All the orders passing by us to other tables looked delicious.

Amazing! The owner and staff is so helpful and knowledgable. They made recommendations for our party of 6 when it was our first time in.   Everything from appetizers to soup to cocktails to entrees was delicious. I substituted and got the garlic noodles instead of the rice that was supposed to come with my meal. Garlic noodle heaven.   Since then I have been back several times. My favorite it the filet mignonette and shrimp with garlic noodles.   Surprise needs more places like this. Small. Well priced. Great food. Different from anything else around.
Great food, very fresh, fun place!  Spring rolls are great  Give it a try for something different in Surprise  THANX
Iced Coffee was PEFECT!  Service was GREAT! Food was EXCELLENT!  I hope to continue seeing this gem around Suprise!   The Pho is one of the best I have had in Phoenix!!!
So amazing how many people on here gave this place 4-5 stars...... Wow, so easily fooled or have never had real Vietnamese chow before.
The food here was so good. I had lunch and I really enjoyed my food. Everyone was so friendly here from the host to the waitress. I will be back.

The food is excellent in this restaurant no matter what you choose for lunch or dinner. We have supported this restaurant since it opened and glad to have it in Surprise. To my disappointment, we visited Saigon Kitchen last evening Jan 25th, 2017 (Wednesday) at 5:15PM. There were many tables empty but each time we asked for a table we were told it was reserved or the table was reserved for larger parties. Keep in mind this is 5:15 in the evening, No one and no groups were lined up outside to get in, plus there were only two people sitting at one of the tables that was reserved for "larger parties" and they were not waiting for anyone as they already had there entree at the table. Due to no available tables, we were told we could eat at the bar- no thank you and we left. I am absolutely shocked that the owner or manager would let customers leave their restaurant due to the lack of customer service from their hostess who has no idea how to take care of customers. Does she not realize that her paycheck comes from customers.

I have been waiting for this place to open. The decor is really nice comparing to those Vietnamese restaurants in Phoenix. Finally good service at a Vietnamese restaurant also. The food is great. I had the shrimp and pork springrolls. The dipping sauce was perfect with it. My hubby had the eggrolls.He enjoyed it as well. Happy hour was great. I had the bbq pork vermicelli and my hubby had the Pho. We both enjoyed our dinner. We definitely will return back.
Best restaurant in the area. We would drive from other parts of the valley to eat here. Garlic noodles, firecracker shrimp, shrimp spring rolls, shaken beef, pho, grilled chicken  it's all good!

Went there last night for the second time since it opened. And just as impressed with the food. Hubby had the san tan devils brew on tap (they also offer four peaks on tap). Started with the crispy egg rolls. They serve them with fresh mint and lettuce leaves and encourage you to wrap the rolls with them. Yum! Hubby had the shaken beef and cleaned the plate. I had the caramelized salmon dish. We both really enjoyed the scallion broth that both dishes are served with. People of Surprise! Don't miss out on this restaurant! We need to keep them in business since we have far too few independently owned restaurants to choose from! Besides, it's delicious!

I give this place a 4 because it saves me a drive to find other pho places.  Otherwise it would be a 3.  I always seem to get a wobbly table (maybe the same one 3 times?) not good with big bowls of hot soup, the music they always have playing is like a psychedelic Muzac and  the service is just ok.  It's probably just me, but I never get a good vibe from this place. I do like the pho and recently tried the Banh Mi with BBQ pork and although my sandwich could have used a little more meat, it was good.  The egg rolls are also very good.

This is one of mine and my husband's favorite restaurant! The atmosphere is perfect for a romantic dinner for two. Their food is amazing! We practically tried the whole menu and would recommend all the dishes on the menu because everything is delicious but our favorites on the menu are the Vietnamese ribs, the beef clay pot and garlic noodles. I'm getting hungry just talking about it.  See you again soon Dennis!
MY Family took me there for father's day. Everyone loved their food.  The service was great. The curry shrimp was out this World!

Came in and was seated before a party of six, we were 3 adults and 2 babies. The party of 6 was seated next to us. The hostess took our drink order and I told her I was ready to order she said the bartender would be there soon to take our order( where's the real waitress) after waiting 10 minutes we finally got our tea and next to us got there drinks. I once again reminded the hostess and bartender we were ready to order now another 10 mins went by and the bartender went to the table next to us and took their order and completely ignored us! Horrible we all got up and left!

Good place. The restaurant was clean and pleasant. The food was good too. My wife and I had the clear eggrolls with peanut sauce. We eat these whenever we have Vietnamese food. Fairly straight forward. Not bad. We also ate the combo pho soup. Very generous portions! Good job. The soup itself is reminiscent of fish sauce/mint/and some other requirement. It seems obviously made for American taste buds. It wasn't very spicy. You can do that yourself I suppose. But still for the inducted, you also require a more robust base to start with. If you want a more authentic soup, it is not here.   They had a small menu. Sometimes that is a good thing, as it helps from choice overload. However, there were some other Vietnamese dishes, I would have liked to see.  The service was friendly and quick. Overall they did just fine. We may return in time to see how they grow.

I have been going to Saigon kitchen since the day they opened. Food has been good great since day one. Menu has expanded and Dennis has taken this restaurant to new heights. I love the food here and the service is great.

This place is amazing!! The best rack of lamb, the new sweet and sour wings are awesoms, the peppered shrimp, and always add a side of garlic noodles. The owner is an awesome guy, now if only he would open up a shop in flagstaff!!

Great place! Wonderful food and service. One WARNING!  Dishes are serve too fast. Most of those around us, as well as us, got their entree well before they had finished appetizers, soup or salad.   Ask waiter to delay placing your dinner order until after first course is finished. Otherwise a five star experience.

First time here for lunch so I was very excited. Ordered goi cuon, grilled chicken sandwich, banh xeo/sizzling cake, and beef pho to share with my lunch date. True to Vietnamese dishes, vegetables were very fresh - bean sprouts, basil, jalapeños, and lettuce. Sandwich and banh xeo were delicious. Pho was average with a lack of spices in the broth. The rice paper for goi cuon was not soaked well and was hard in certain areas.   The service was also average. We were the only people there and it took longer than expected to get the food. Five minutes the first dish of goi cuon and 20 to 25 minutes for the pho and banh xeo. I imagine if there were a few more tables, the wait would be much longer.

The perfect Asian fusion, the smell alone will bring you in, but the flavors will bring you back!! Love the fillet, & pho. The owners really care & it shows. No other place I'll go for Asian food in the West Valley!
Take out pho not assembled...raw meat in container with noodles. Gross! Egg drop soup was neon orange. Everything else was just like any other greasy Chinese takeout.
Eating at Saigon Kitchen makes my visits to Surprise, AZ even better and look forward to many more experiences at this establishment.
Hands down the best place in Surprise.  My favorites are the Shaken Beef and Viet ribs.  Friendly service and clean place.

Any review using the phrases "the meat is always tender" and "peanut sauce" is sure to be a four-star review or higher, right? Well this one is.  My parents love taking out-of-town guests here and we have not yet heard a complaint from any of our visitors. The food has been pretty good so far, but I have avoided ordering the pho as what tastes I've had from my mother's orders didn't seem to be up to par with what I'm used to (and spoiled by) in San Diego. Well, it's not San Diego, but for a Phoenix suburb, it's still pretty good food.  In terms of wait service, I find it pretty baffling what poor service others have reported. We have generally had pretty great service at Saigon Kitchen, particularly from Hue, but once in a while some of their servers seem a little disorganized and distracted. During my last visit, I requested extra peanut sauce (even though it doesn't usually go with the dish I ordered), and the waiter told me "No, this is the sauce," and pointed at the nuoc cham (dipping sauce). I told him that I understood but that I wanted extra peanut sauce. Finally another waitress with a little more sense told me that she could go get it, but I was just too annoyed by the other server who kept refusing a reasonable request - something my dad asks for and had just gotten a moment earlier, actually - that I told her I'd be fine. (And yes. I'm also childishly laughing every time I say peanut sauce. There! Did it again...)  Other than a few minor miscues, I really enjoy lunch here. The meat is always tender and all the ingredients seem fresh. I like the shrimp rolls quite a lot. On my last visit, I ordered Vietnamese iced coffee, and at first was disappointed because it seemed kind of small; after trying it I realized that it was just too rich to be served any bigger. I'd order it again though.  My favorite thing is the combo bun. Shrimp, pork, and egg rolls - can't go wrong with this one. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the serving size was ample.  One day I will have to order the pho, but again I don't think it will measure up to the hole-in-the-wall places in San Diego, and that's okay. I'll still come here with my parents and enjoy other dishes.  And the peanut sauce.

The Family and I have taken an interest in Vietnamese food.  After a horrible first experience about 6 years ago we have decided to give it another try.  The only other Vietnamese place we've eaten at, excluding the the place we didn't like and I can't remember, is Pho Avenia (which we like) and neither of us is well versed in Vietnamese cuisine so I can only review Saigon on my own standards of what I like and don't like. What I don't like: Booths.  I despise booths in any eating establishment.  They are always too low and my food ends up at chest level.  The backs are too far away and it makes my lower back hurt straining for support. Sadly for me, The Wife and The Boy love booths.  I have no idea why. Saigon Kitchen has the best of both worlds. . .table booths!  Kind of like the Spork of furniture only not as funny looking.  Everyone in The Family was pleased all around! The decor is nice (and new) and we were promptly seated at 6pm on a Friday night.  Our server came over and took our drink orders and gave us a few minutes to look over the menu.  My iced tea and The Boy's soda were brought to us promptly, but after about 10 minutes we flagged down our server and asked about The Wife's drink (some kind of fruity cocktail thing) Our server informed us the bar was a bit backed up but her drink was on it's way.  Although our server was smiling while explaining, it seemed to me it was through clenched teeth and I definitely got the impression she was imagining my death by asphyxiation at her own hands in her head while explaining this to me.  Not cool. I suppose I can understand though.  The place had filled up fast and the "20 something" hostess was sitting on her butt instead of helping out like she should have. We ordered spring rolls for an appetizer.  They arrived hot and crispy but they were just spring rolls.  Nothing outstanding, mind you, but at least they weren't greasy.  The Wife had the lemongrass chicken which I tasted and thought was pretty good.  Nice and tangy with large chunks of white meat chicken.  The Boy had Shrimp Fried Rice and I had the #1 Combination called "Com Dac Blet" which was basically Pork, more pork and some shrimp.  I tasted The Wife's dish.  Nice.  I tasted The Boy's dish, not bad.  Mine was outstanding.  Lots of meat and plenty of shrimp. All tender and cooked to perfection. I've heard the phrase "I don't know art but I know what I like" well I don't know Vietnamese food, but I know what I like.  I absolutely like what we had at Saigon Kitchen and will be going back soon to see what else I like.

I'm no expert on authentic Vietnamese cuisine, I just like what I like and I know when I like it. Let me remind you that this place is located in Surprise AZ. Your typical fare here is Chicken wings and burgers. I would say that no pho is terrible if the bean sprouts are crunchy, the cilantro is fresh and clean, and if the broth is hot enough to make you sweat like like a priest in a comic shop.

Went there with the family for Father's Day and will definitely go back again (just not with the family).  I ordered the Combination Pho.  Now it's been years since I had eaten Pho as there were no Vietnamese places near me.  I don't remember exactly how the Pho tasted at Da Vang years ago, but I know it was better than here.  But Siagon Kitchen's Pho was still excellent.  The meatballs are very tasty and the broth has a unique sweetness to it.  I would definitely eat this dish again.  My wife had a combination rice plate that was very good as well.  The biggest surprise was the chicken sandwiches that the kids got.  They did not like them (why I won't go with the family again), but I had them for leftover lunches for the next three days.  At $5 these are an absolute steal.  They are tasty with grilled chicken, diakons (a radish type veggie), cucumbers, carrots and cilantro.  These would be perfect to pop in and have for lunch.

Last Night, as usual, FOOD WAS GREAT.   Service not so much.  Had a reservation and was seated right away.  The restaurant was nearly empty but all of the occupied tables were crowded together.  There was no one seated at any of the wall booths or corners of the dining room.  I was bumping chairs with tables on both sides of us.  I guess the staff didn't want to walk to far to take care of the customers. Service was so fast I thought I was at a fast food restaurant.  I had not yet finished my salad nor started on the soup when they were serving the entrees.  Less than 15 minutes from ordering to entree.  Didn't have time to enjoy the beer or conversation with our dining companions.   Server was also off last night.  She served cocktails and just set them on the edge of the table so we served ourselves from there. We enjoy the food so much we will be back so hopefully last night was just an off night for everyone there.

Excellent Vietnamese dinning.  The food was all very tasty and priced fairly. The owner personally visited our table and was genuinely happy to see us (my parents frequent this establishment).  I would definitely return!

Great place to go post-Christmas!  Newer, clean atmosphere, and thanks to the yelpers, we ordered the firecracker shrimp. I loved these (good taste and quality shrimp)...the sauce was a bit much for my sister...the consistency of a sauce for honey walnut prawns...which is not what she was looking for. I gladly ate most of them!  The garlic noodles, while good, also seemed to be cooked with a LOT of butter, which I wasn't ready for and left a weird, heavy after-taste so we didn't finish those.  We also started with the fresh spring rolls that were delicious and their dipping sauce was good. Wish they kept siracha/other sauces on the table or brought them out right away with the food, but that is just a little thing.  Also ordered the combo rice--awesome! Totally missed we could have added an egg to the top-dang it! Good portion and flavor, and I love that they accompany it with scallion broth and a salad-a great touch.  When I am back in AZ, I will definitely return!

I have eaten at Saigon Kitchen in Surprise AZ before and enjoyed it.  This time I ordered the noodles with filet mignon.  I could not chew it enough to swallow it.  I chewed and chewed to no avail.  I brought it home and cooked it some more but with the same result.  The color bothered me too.  It was not pink inside.  It was a bluish/red.  Could it have been another meat other than beef?  Perplexed.

Ordered to go two pho combos and one pho meatball. They said it would take 25-30 mins. By the time we got there it has already been 25 mins and we still had to wait an extra 15 mins before it was ready. When I got home one of the orders was wrong I got a beef stew instead of pho combo & my pho meat ball had hair in it. I won't be coming back.
Delicious! The Filet was amazing, and the Rock Shrimp blew me away!  Little siracha on the garlic noodles and I was in heaven! The pork egg rolls and the shrimp egg rolls are a MUST.

The food here is good, the pho with shrimp mushrooms and bok choy is great! The only complaint I have about this place is they don't have enough people taking orders.  Every time I have been there it has been busy, and they have only two people taking orders and one of them is the bar tender.  Keep up the great food but increase the service some.

My family and I went into the Saigon Kitchen last night for dinner. This restaurant is located in Surprise on the far west side.  First impressions walking in it's a really cool restaurant very modern the lighting was awesome and the tables were what I would put into my own home. We were seated promptly and our server took really good care of us he very attentive. Secondly the food there were eight people in our party and all said it was very good. In particular the dynamite shrimp my son had this dish. I sampled it it was amazing. I had the salmon when it was good. We also had a large bowl of pho  it was average at best.  I was also disappointed in the portion size. You pay on average $15 a plate but the portion sizes we're not much bigger than what you would receive for an appetizer. One thing that disappointed me as well  was all the staff were teenagers. It did not appear that they had a manager on staff the night we went in. Now I'm not saying I do not appreciate teenagers I have three of my own. But without supervision teenagers tend to be teenagers. We were seated right by the drink station.  That is where they would congregate and talk about their lives right next to our table. When you were spending $200 for dinner I don't want to hear who you're making out with and who you're dating. I don't care about your text messages. I just want to eat my dinner in peace  and enjoy my friends and family. It's just not appropriate. Generally I don't like to review a place after only one visit. I like to visit a few times before I decide whether I like the place or not. In this case I would return for the food for sure. Just maybe for special occasions or for lunch when they have reduced prices. Kind of scared to see what the lunch portions look like though.

I wish I had pictures, but Saigon Kitchen makes the best fried rice ever! My husband ordered the beef pho and loved it as well!! The customer service was amazing! They made feel right at home!  I visited a few weeks ago and now back home in Maryland. I think of the fried rice I had all the time and even tried another Vietnamese restaurant friend rice in MD, definitely doesn't compare!!! Highly recommend this place!!

The Pho and ice coffee it's delicious! I recommend it. The only complain I have it's that it does take a bit of long time for your order to come out and the menus smell terrible.  They should cleaning with clean towels. Over all I give it a 4*

In my opinion, the best restaurant in Surprise. Went there on Saturday night. Modern atmosphere, local craft beer and amazing food.  Service was excellent. Justin was our waiter and he couldn't have been better. We also liked Andrew. He came to our table several times to clear dishes away and he was super friendly. Tried the Lemongrass Filet with shrimp, delicious!  My favorite was the Shaken Beef.    This is a place we will crave and be back often.

This place is fantastic!!!!  Great food, great customer service and great pricing.  The owner Dennis has this place firing on all cylinders.  He has nailed the food quality and role models how all restaurant owners should run their business.  I had the Surf and Turf Shaken Beef.  Words cannot describe how good this dish was....an unbelievable sauce.  I highly recommend you visit this restaurant!!!!
Loved the firecracker shrimp & garlic noodles! Was our first time here, but will definitely be back!!
The pork bahn mi is fantastic, crispy egg rolls and the lemongrass beef stir fry with vermicelli noodles. ..very tasty! A huge compliment coming from an Asian.

I've tried other Vietnamese restaurants but none compare to Saigon Kitchen.  The food is amazing, the atmosphere is fantastic, the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful.  Thank goodness they're so close to home!

My family and I have been to this restaurant many, many times and have never (ever!) been disappointed by the food or the service.  However, if you do not call ahead on weekends, you are in for a LONG wait at times.  (People...the food is THAT good!)  I always get the Shrimp Spring Rolls with peanut dipping sauce.  They're HUGE!  Two people could easily share one order.    For my main meal I have had the Fillet Mignon Shaken Beef, the Sizzling Salmon, the Caramelized Salmon, and the Firecracker Shrimp w/ Garlic Noodles.  All were equally outstanding and I truly have a hard time deciding what I want once we get ready to order.  I have no one favorite since they are all delicious!  My husband generally leans toward the Pho or one of the fried rice entrees.  All of those are equally delicious as well.  All specialty plates come with jasmine rice, a side salad and scallion broth.

Wanted a warm bowl of pho on this cold AZ day. Stopped in and order the hot tea to start. Definitely not your traditional tea served at some restaurants that is brewed in kettle and poured into small tea cups. No, this came in a tea bag steeped in a coffee mug. The decor right down to the presentation of the food has an air of modern/chic. The plate of accouterments (hoisin sauce, siracha, bean sprouts, etc) was compartmentalized on a plate and made it difficult to scoop both the sauces from it.   The presentation did detract from the normal, heaping portions of hoisin sauce that I dump into my pho. I decided not to ask for more thinking that I may have been overdoing it all of these years, but alas, I could barely taste it. I did order the large pho thai (thin cuts of steak cooked by the broth), but it only came with 5 pieces of meat that were a little larger than a silver dollar. I'd hate to see what I'd get with the small.   Overall, the noodles were cooked well and the broth was delicious leaving me thoroughly warmed. This was a nice place to have lunch and a welcome change from the typical caddy of chopsticks and soup spoons at the table with a diner style napkin dispenser.

I've been here a few times (not by my choice) and this place is mediocre at best, so I have no idea why so many people are giving them raving reviews. Let me go through my phoanalysis...  Pho: The broth is nothing to write home about. It's not terrible nor bland, but it's certainly not memorable. The meat, noodles, and vegs were fresh.  Spring rolls: Decent, but once again, not amazing. There weren't any mint in the rolls I had and the peanut sauce is disappointing.   Where the restaurant lost huge points with me was the inflated over-priced menu. The small bowls of pho are $7-8 and $8-9 for large, depending on which one you order. The bahn mis were $5-6, are you kidding me? And $5 for two spring rolls. It defeats the whole purpose of eating pho which is supposed to be cheap and convenient. Saigon Kitchen has more of a modern lounge feel to it, and that's not what I want in Vietnamese food. Focus on the food, not the decor.  Some bonus points for the bar. They have variety of beers on draft: Sapporo, Kilt Lifter, Blue Moon, Coors Light, and some type of pale ale I couldn't make out. There's a small selection of liquor available also.  Overall, I'm not a fan of SK. But my friend who lives nearby drags me there once in a while. I'd much rather make the trip to Central King Eggroll who has the best pho in the valley, so far, from my experience.

What a great addition to Surprise and best of all it's not to far from my house. I'm stationed at Luke Air Force base  and I've had tried many vietnamese restaurants  from coast to coast. Hands down this is ranked at the top of my list. It's clean, modern and the staff is friendly, not to mention the food is outstanding.   So far I've been there 6 times and won't stop, the food keeps calling me. The wife and kid love it as well.  Check it out, you won't  be disappointed.
In the greater Phoenix area places that serve Pho are hit and miss.  Saigon Kitchen is a 'hit'!
Shaken beef probably the best thing chicken wings very dry suggest not to get the wings and pho ,spring roll are good too

SERVICE IS THE WORST IN SURPRISE. Read more to get my story. I made this account JUST so I could rate this place. I went here - the first time, with my boyfriend. We sat at the bar, ordered drinks, appetizers, and entrees. This is what happened: 1. We got our drinks.  2. Waitress asked for our order... we gave what we wanted for appetizers. After that, she immediately turned to another customer at the bar asking their order so we didn't get a chance to finish what we wanted for entrees. My boyfriend repeatedly said, "Mam", and "Miss", but she didn't notice us until after she took the other people's order. Even so - she didn't give us her full attention.  3. We received our appetizers. I ordered another drink.  4. 20 minutes go by and I still haven't gotten my drink, so I flag down a waitress and repeat to her that I ordered a drink and haven't received it.  5. I get my drink.  6. Another 30 minutes go by and we notice that people who ordered after us have eaten and are paying their bills. We flag down the waitress. 7. Confusion ensues, she says our order was in the computer... doesn't even ADDRESS us, talks to the cook.  8. We wait MORE, finally the cook apologizes to me, then comes back and asks us what we order and tells me that our food was delivered to another table. I said "OK". 9. We wait 5 minutes and I get my entree and bf gets his BUT IT IS NOT WHAT HE ORDERED. 10. We flagged down the waitress AGAIN and told her that he didn't get what he ordered and she gets the cook. He comes out and asks what my boyfriend ordered.  11. After my boyfriend orders, I try to talk to the cook and tell him that this service is unacceptable, it is our first time in this place and that the meal better be comped because we go to Pei Wei just down the way anyway... but BEFORE I COULD FINISH MY SENTENCE HE WALKED AWAY.  12. My boyfriend got his meal.  13. Waitress comes by, comps one beverage. Then, she makes excuses and she never apologizes. She tells us that they are just so busy and she has never seen it so busy, etc.  14. At this point, I am not even hungry. I tried to tell the waitress that we are unhappy and that it was our first time here. She shook her head. A few minutes later she said to us, "Well was your food OK at least?" Boyfriend said, "It was OK, can we get our check." 13. She brought us our check... they charged us for everything and didn't even try to win back our patronage.   After such an AWFUL experience, I will never go back. I enjoyed the food but I wanted to have a romantic night out with my boyfriend and they RUINED it. I just got back and I am writing this review... Service was terrible in my opinion. They didn't try to win us back as costumers after REPEATED mistakes. I should have gotten an apology for EVERY mistake made, but I only received one apology, a cold shoulder (when the cook walked away when I was talking), a whole bunch of excuses, and one comped beverage.  I will never be back. I will tell all my friends to never go there. I make a newsletter for a resort in Surprise that over 2 thousand people read and I will make sure to never advertise for Saigon Kitchen and I will let as many people know as I can why they should NOT GO TO THIS PLACE.    We paid the bill, left. Wrote "WILL NOT RETURN" on the waitress's copy, left no tip, and left.   Thanks for nothing, Saigon Kitchen. That was the first and last time for me.

Been to the Saigon Kitchen 3 times now.  Once with a friend, another with my teenage daughter and other on a lunch date with my husband.  Will have to say have been absolutely pleased each time.  I ordered the Shaken beef (diced Filet Mignon) each time.  Husband ordered the Chicken Curry (which he liked) and we enjoyed egg rolls.    The food has been hot, tastes fresh, excellent presentation and absolutely delicious.  Portions, in my opinion, are definitely a good portion---just right.  Entree is served with white rice, soup/broth, and a tasty shredded side salad with a great Asian dressing.    Staff was polite and attentive, food came out in a timely manner.  Have thoroughly enjoyed my experience each time.   They play nice "Global Ambient" music, the restaurant is somewhat small yet cozy.  It has a nice "grown up" simple Asian feel.  Definitely a great place to meet a significant other or good friend to lunch.    NOT a place I would recommend for children; tables are somewhat close together and it has a relaxing feel.  Menu seemingly NOT designed with kids meals etc.  Also a bit expensive if considering price.  Hubby and I each had the Shaken Beef lunch with egg roll appetizer and drinks, it came out to $39.    Worth the money, but if you are watching budget on a lunch date, just something to consider.  We definitely have listed this as a favorite place for us to dine sans kids!

First time here on a Sunday and it will be our last. If I could give this place zero stars I would! Never will we step foot into this establishment ever again!  Please see below for my reasons.  1.) Food was way overpriced for what you get and it is mediocre food. I ordered chicken pho and when it came out I thought it was the kid's size. Do yourself a favor and go to a better and reasonably priced vietnamese restaurant, there are a lot out there folks! Really don't understand what all the hype is about this place. We are foodies and have had really good authentic vietnamese food and this place just does not cut it.  2.) Waited over 30 mins to be seated (arrived a little before 6:30 pm on a Sunday night) for a party of 5, not really part of the reason I'm writing this review since I do understand that they were busy when we came and we agreed to wait.  3.) We did not get our food until after 1 hour!!! We are only a party of 5. We sat down at 7 pm, server took our drink orders within 5 minutes of sitting down. 5 minutes later she came back with our drinks and we ordered immediately since we had over 30 mins to look over the menu while we waited outside. By the time we received our food after 1 hour, tables that sat down after us started to leave. I don't understand why we received our food so late as almost half of the restaurant was empty by then.   4.) We complained to a "manager" since the wait was just too ridiculous! The so called "manager" basically gave us a lame excuse of why it took so long and offered us a free dessert. We denied the dessert even though it was free as we just didn't want to sit at that restuarant any longer. However, if they were a restaurant that cared about their customers they would have offered us a discount or even to take off an appetizer that we had ordered but nothing of that sort! Also, throughout the time that we were waiting for our mediocre food, we saw the actual owner/manager go around tables checking to see, I'm guessing people he knows, if they were statisfied and never even once did he laid eyes on our table.  This restuarant not only did not satisfy my hunger but I left feeling angry! Also, after we paid I noticed other servers/workers looking at our table like we did something wrong... felt humiliated as we are not the type to complain. I've never been to a restaurant and experienced treatment like this...ever... McDonald's treats their customers better than this! Never again!!! Do yourselves a favor, please go somewhere else!!! There are a ton of wonderful Vietnamese restuarants around the valley!

I've been coming here for 5+ years and never miss it when I visit Surprise, AZ.  I have to say that I'm fearful that Dennis is allowing his standards to slip just a little.  A few things that seem to have changed: 1.  The Shaken Beef is my "go-to" order and has always been amazing.  For the first time it seems to have been top sirloin beef instead of the advertised filet mignon - or worst case, a lower grade of beef. 2.  Service seems to have slipped.  Very friendly wait staff, but bussers that would walk right by the table empty-handed without clearing empty plates.  Perhaps was just an oversight, but did not used to be the case. 3.  Lastly, the lobster tail special during the Thanksgiving week was a major disappointment.  Overcooked in the shell, could not get the meat free from the shell and when we did it was a bit dried out.  My future visits will continue because I just can't miss the fabulous flavor of Shaken Beef.  My hope is that the prior superior standards return - and soon!!

This is one of my favorite places to eat in Surprise and I'm glad the city is finally getting some ethnic choices, especially Asian.   I'm a huge fan of the Lemongrass Chicken, which is normally the only entree I order.  I've tried the Curry Chicken but it just wasn't for me, although my sister did like it.  My mother tried the BBQ Pork Sandwich and she found it to be a nice surprise, full of flavor and very satisfying.  Also tried the Wings (House Sauce) for the first time and found them delicious as well.  Although not a fan of fish, the wings did not have any fishy taste and were slightly sweet and ample.  The staff is very attentive and friendly, which is a huge plus in my book.  Will definitely continue to frequent SK!  My only grip is that one of the staff likes to park his truck in the first space in front of the restaurant.  Although there is plenty of parking, I just find it unseemly for employees to take up the front spaces, since these should be reserved for customers.

Drove to Surprise for lunch today and tried Saigon Kitchen. I had Firecracker Shrimp and Wife had Pho. We started with some eggrolls for an appetizer.  The Firecracker Shrimp was outstanding and I really liked the garlic noodles that they came with. I ordered a bowl of Scallion Broth and it was delicious. The salad that came with it was basic but the dressing was very good.  The eggrolls were not the best we've had and we actually didn't finish them. Not bad, just not the best I've had.  My wife said the Pho was just mediocre and the Pho places in Goodyear are better.  While we won't drive here for Pho we will be back for the other items on the menu. The place is a bit spendy but the atmosphere is nice and the food I had was very good.

This restaurant is delicious.  YUM.  Fresh tasting peanut sauce on the spring rolls ... and delicious spring rolls.  It's small and the décor is trendy.  I saw kids there but if I were you I'd try to avoid busy times b'c it's not too big.  Good service.  A little on the expensive side but they serve a mean lychiejito.

AMAZING! We could not believe that we had driven by this place so many times and never stopped here. From the outside we always assumed this was like a Pei Wei... not even close! This is a very nice little place, atmosphere is great, staff is great, food is awesome. We had the shaken beef, firecracker shrimp, and the garlic noodles. All of them were just awesome. We've definitely found our new favorite place.

Used to love it, had the best shrimp appetizer around, now apparently they have decided to cut costs and the shrimp they are using have been reduced in size by close to 50%, same price,half the food,  When we asked about it, I was told that they use less batter.... wrong.  If you want to keep customers, do not save a buck at their expense. Posted pics comparing what they used to have vs what they have now, would rather pay an extra buck as opposed to getting something I could order at Long John Silvers.  Unfortunate.
We had shrimp curry and marinated grilled chicken salad. Both were excellent as was the service.

I do enjoy this restaurant, but let me be honest; I wouldn't say it's very authentic.  It does have great flavors and the staff is very nice.  I have been greeted by the owner on every visit and I appreciate how attentive he is.  I enojy going in for a cocktail and their pho good.  The regular size isn't as large as other places but it will leave you full.  It's fancy for veitnamese food.

Mix of good and not so great. Arrived at 6:30 on a Friday so expected a wait. Ended up being about 35 minutes. Drinks and appetizer arrived quickly and we ordered food quickly because we saw other reviews about a long wait. Did not get entrees until one hour after we ordered, and almost all tables had cleared out. Long wait, slow drink service. Crispy egg rolls were bland, stir fry was ok, but firecracker shrimp was amazing and well worth the price. Order some to take home.

A fabulous variety of Vietnamese food.  The Shaken Beef is my favorite dish.  It's filet with grilled onions, rice, soup and salad.  I have a hard time trying other dishes because I get the shaken beef everytime.  The garlic noodles and beef is awesome and the spring roles are a great appetizer.  We've been eating here since they opened in Surprise and it's one of our favorite places to eat out here.

Delicous!!  We had the shrimp & pork spring rolls (after dinner ordered another to-go!)  I got the chicken sandwich, amazing with carrots and cilantro.  Hubby got the Beef Pho, which he loved.  Heard about great happy hour specials like 2 apps & a bottle of wine for $20!  Can't  wait to go back :)
Love their shrimp spring rolls with mint. Garlic noodles are yummy, the Pho is great, and the pork sliders are amazBalls

my wife and I usually go here every couple weeks. the severs are very nice and the food is amazing. I see the owner talking to some regulars all the time wish he would walk our way once in a while but I'm sure that day will eventually come. awesome place!

I wasn't thrilled with this place.  I had the filet pho, which was nothing to be excited about.  It hardly had any veggies in it, and the mushrooms made it taste weird.  The meat was excellent and so was the broth, however the small portion is very small for the price.  There are better restaurants to get more for your money.
I got the combination Pho. Super flavorful. Will definitely be back and will tell my friends.

Saigon Kitchen - 5 Stars  Location: Bell and Litchfield in Surprise. Very close to home. Plenty of parking and easy access back onto Bell Road. I need to come here way more often.  Atmosphere: Upscale and trendy, but laid back. Looks and feels like a Vegas restaurant. The patio seating looked very comfortable and inviting, but we wanted to sit inside. The music was ambient/trance. Reminded me of the Downtown Cocktail Room in Vegas. But with better lighting.  Cleanliness: Very clean and well organized. Even the restroom was nice and tidy.  Service: Cathy was very attentive and made several excellent recommendations. She kept our water glasses and our wine glasses full.  Food/Drinks: Delicious! The Chicken Noodle Soup was outstanding. I can't wait to go back and order it again. We also got Shrimp & Pork Spring Rolls, Chicken Skewers, and Surprise Jumbo Shrimp. The dipping sauces were awesome. The peanut sauce for the spring rolls was pretty yummy.   Happy Hour: The Happy Hour food menu is from 3-6, but the Happy Hour for drinks runs from 11-6. Bargain! During Happy Hour you can get a bottle of wine and two apps for just $30. Totally worth it.  Price: Very reasonable. The large bowl of soup for $9 overfeeds two people. Good portions for the price.

The service is horrible here. I sat for 10 mins at the bar and I wasn't even offered something to drink let alone to take my order. The food is decent but over priced. You can find more authentic Vietnamese food in Phoenix or Goodyear for less $.

I've never had a bad experience here which is why my family orders here a lot. When we sit down and it's busy we don't feel neglected. The staff makes no excuses to the fact they are busy and they work their butts off to ensure the guests feel like they're their only guest. Their food is also top notch. The Pho is awesome and their sandwiches are even better. They have also never made a mistake in any of my to-go orders placed in person or online. This is amazing. We come here a lot and we will keep coming back because we've never been let down.

GOOD FOOD. GOOD PRICE. NICE LADY.  Pho is great. Let me tell you, I am a PHOnatic and Saigon Kitchen has some great pho. The broth is very good and cleanses my soul haha.  Chicken Fried Rice is also good. Spring rolls were on point, Haven't tried anything else yet, but I will soon. Nice lady, too friendly.
