This place is great! Authentic banh mi, pho, and all other Vietnamese specialties! They have a few generic Chinese dishes but if you want a winner stick with the Vietnamese!   Bbq pork in or on anything its amazing, on the banh mi, or in rice best i have ever had. Great bread on the sandwich, crusty outside, super soft & fresh inside.   Every ingredient used looked and tasted amazing and could not be more fresh!  Already planning what i want on my next visit! Can't wait!

The service is slow and non attentive. If you can get over that the food is delicious. We had the chicken pho, very flavorful and great portions. The marinated pork spring rolls were fresh and served with a delicious peanut sauce. The bun(rice noodles with other delicious items) was great. The pork was some of the best pork I have ever tasted. The fried egg rolls had a great crispy outside and delicious fresh inside.

Now I am going to hope the Vietnamese Ribs are on the menu every time, they are sooooooooooooooooo delicious!  I have also been HOOKED on the house chicken wings, I call them fish -chicken, which I know doesn't sound appealing, but OHHHH it is!! They are out of this world!

A modern, clean restaurant located in a strip plaza along Bell road in surprise. We had the egg roll appetizer. It was served piping hot with a light oil dipping sauce. They were very tasty. For the entree I had the Saigon fried rice. A very large portion with good flavor but I thought the shrimp was a little overdone. My wife had the firecracker shrimp served over garlic noodles. Very good flavor, generous portion, and the shrimp was lightly breaded and fried.    Service was good. All the staff was friendly and attentive. Drinks were refilled without having to ask. Food was served hot.    Overall, a positive experience. I would recommend.

My boyfriend and I have been loyal patrons to Saigon Kitchen for some time now. Each time we go back, it gets better and better. There has not been a single dish we've tried that has been anything less than extraordinary. Like another reviewer here, I literally have to force myself to try something new because I like each dish that much, but each time I do I find a brand new favorite. My boyfriend is partial to the Dennis sandwich - a perfect blend of slightly spicy with fresh cilantro - and my favorite is the chicken pho. But recently, we tried the pork tenderloin special atop garlic noodles and it was outta-this-world delicious!   Moreover, the staff here is truly spectacular. Personable, attentive, and full of great recommendations on what to try if you just can't decide. We've come multiple times during a lunch or dinner rush and they always seem to handle the hungry masses with ease.    If you've been debating on going here for the first time, do yourself a big favor and try it! You really can't go wrong with this place.

This restaurant continues to make us happy!  The additional space is lovely and the food is great!  The service was attentive without being overly fussy.  Great experience.  Look at "Check Please" for their reviews!
Love Saigon. We have been coming here since they first opened. They have grown a lot and the food is still amazing from when we first tried it. The shake in beef is a must try :)
The beef pho is really good and the shrimp/pork spring rolls is pretty good also.

I have been driving by this place what seems like forever now and I decided it was time to try it out...I sat down and I noticed the menu was a little short and didn't really know what to pick. The waitress was super friendly but that all did not matter to my 5 year old who wanted to color and was told they had no colors for her...besides that point I decided I was going to pick the shaken beef and my husband chose the pho. The food arrived, it was nothing short of amazing. My husband has yet to find good Pho since he left Portland, OR this place finally gave him the Pho he was looking for. The shaken beef hmm where to start, the sauce, it is truly scrumptious, I took one bite two bites three bites and could not stop until it was gone! The prices are well a little pricey unless you come at lunch they have some specials unfortunately at the time shaken beef was not one. The food, service and atmosphere awards this place a 5 star. Will be back :)

Excellent on all levels. Small, casual, great-friendly service, and the food was super fantastic!!! Crispy Salmon, Filet Mignon on a sizzling platter, Shrimp Fried Rice, Surprise Shrimp are all have great flavor and very fresh. Prices are reasonable and a good value.

This used to be my favorite restaurant.  I hadnt been there in about 2 years.  I went there yesterday and was GREATLY disappointed with the service, the portion sizes, and the quality of the food.  I didn't feel the family oriented atmosphere that I once felt... and I was nickel and dimed for extra bean sprouts and lime and basil for my pho which at one point the portion originally came with what I was now being charged $2 extra for.  The server just kind of shrugged her shoulders when I asked what had happened and why with no real answer.  My pho wasn't hot enough at all.  I feel like the restaurant traded up quality of food and service for a bigger and fancier place..   I was disappointed enough to never go back there again.

This place never disappoints! The food is always done to perfection. Dennis is a great business owner who likes to make sure his customers are always happy. I recommend this place to anyone in the mood for some amazing food and a great atmosphere, Every dish that I have ever tried has been to die for!!!
Excellent service, Josh was extremely attentive and helpful.   The pork patty is amazing, quite possibly the best pork I've every had.
My new favorite for the summer heat! As always I am treated like a VIP and this was the new recommendation for me. Ahi tuna salad

Great food awesome service...we will be back! Shaken beef is to die for and they have great iced tea. We came for an early dinner on the Friday before Valentine's Day and they only had room outside. What a treat, beautiful outside area and comfortable surroundings.

We originally were going to go to Pei Wei but they had closed because their hot water wasn't working.  We went here as an alternative & am so glad we did.  It was amazing.  We had the Asian wings for an appetizer. Great!  I ordered the Filet Mignon Shaken Beef that came with egg drop soup and salad.  My husband ordered the Surf and turf fried rice.  It came with egg drop soup. Everything was cooked to perfection.  My meat was so tender. We ate on the patio and the service was good. Everything was exactly as it should be. The only down side is it is rather expensive. Comparable to PF Chang's in price and that wasn't what our budget was originally. However, I'd highly recommend this establishment.
Wonderful service and the best PHO in town. Everytime we come here were treated like family. It's a beautiful resturant and bar , family owned and  very clean.

I come here a lot but lately I realized that that prize of there food is too expensive .the owner needs to lower the prices of the entrees. Pho soup is not that good, it's smaller and more expensive compare to PT noodles Vietnamese restaurant located at Litchfield. If you want us to come more often lower the prices thank you

Tried Saigon kitchen for the first time tonight.  Had the shaken beef which they have gotten great reviews for. The flavored were good and I liked it but it was a bit too salty. Drank a ton of water to make up for the salt. ThE garlic soup and dessert was yummy. We also had the combination rice plate which was very good.
My first time there.   It was busy but the team their was attentive.  The good was good and quick.   Was good to see more traditional food verses fried.

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal!  We tried the lemongrass wings as an appetizer. (Yum) then we had the charbroiled pork. (Yum!)  However the lycheejito was the bomb! Lychee infused vodka with tonic, lime and mint. Our server (Lindsey) was friendly, helpful and quick! Overall a very good meal!
Love this place. The food and service is always really good. My favorite is the garlic noodles w beef and the lemongrass edamames.
Pretty restaurant but I ordered summer rolls take-out for first time and disliked the peanut sauce which is what makes these so yummy. Not peanutty enough with an of bitter after taste.

5++ stars. I can't say enough positive things about this restaurant. From the food, to the service, décor and beverage selections.... this is an A+ restaurant!  My husband and I both love the pho, there are many different variations for your protein (shrimp, filet, tofu and meatball, and more)...but the base of the broth is what makes it so delicious. We are also huge fans of their other menu items: shaken beef with Garlic noodles is a must try, as well as the Rice Vermicelli options if you want to have something a little lighter. We have tried most things on the menu and each item has been excellent.   The area is a bit small, so plan on a slight wait during busy times, but it is well worth the time spent!   Service is attentive and pleasant, and the owners presence is a refreshing reminder of the quality of service and passion for delicious food!
We love this restaurant! Great service. Freshest food in the west valley! The pho is quite possibly the best I have ever had! Try the spring rolls. You won't be sorry. Go there....now!

This was the most awkward and uncomfortable place I have ever eaten in. Our waiter took forever to help us, but after I finally got helped I saw another couple awkwardly looking around for their waiter so they can order, they didn't even get their drinks yet. My waiter barely spoke above a whisper, he stood right in front of my table and I didn't know he was there until I heard a faint "hey there how you doing today"...... Next, while I'm eating, I see a couple walk in and look around for the hostess but of course she's not at her post, she's hanging out with the bus boys by the silverware that aren't even being folded. It's not even busy and the people who work here don't seem to have a clue wtf is going on. No one has any personality or sense of urgency. I wouldn't think to come here during a dinner rush bc they can barely handle the slow hours. Good food tho

From the very first the service and attention to detail was great  The bar was ever so friendly and fine to sit until our table was ready Once we ordered the food come out fast hot and so tasty  The spring rolls are a must. Next the beef soup is outstanding and so yummy!!!

So this was my second time at Vietnamese food and I'm still a huge fan! The service here was super friendly and helpful. As I am a novice with this cuisine, I asked lots of questions and the server was happy to oblige with recommendations. I had doubts against jalapenos on the Bahn Mi sandwich and tendons in the Pho. They can omit them with no problem! I don't like super sweet. Avoid the lemongrass chicken! What is that delicious smell from the next table's meal? It's the Shaken Beef with onions! We started with the crispy egg roll (wrap it with the lettuce and mint provided, trust me) and it was out of this world. Cheap too at 4 for $5 or $3 during Happy Hour. We got the Pho with meatballs. The Pho was awesome, almost as good as what I had in San Francisco, but the meatballs were hard and kind of rubbery. I have learned that this is the way they are meant to be, it's a texture that Americans find difficult though. The flavor was good, but next time I'll try it with the steak or chicken. The firecracker shrimp were yummy (not as spicy as we were led to believe, but good) and the garlic noodles were sweet and buttery and delicious. Though they were too sweet for Hubby and other posters, I liked them. I guess it's subjective. The Bahn Mi was very tasty as well. The bread was top notch but the pate (we got the everything version) was a little much for me. I'll get the plain pork next time, but won't discourage other more adventurous people from getting the works. All in all, it was wonderful and we will definitely be going back again, only with the kids.

Maybe I ordered the wrong dish.  I had pork 2 ways and a few grilled shrimp over rice.  This came with a small bowl of blah chicken broth and a nondescript  salad.  Shrimp was fine as were the two small pieces of BBQ pork, though way too salty.   The pork chop was horrible...tough as shoe leather and also way too salty.  The waitress was very pleasant, and perky, though way too loud.   The bus boy who cleared the table couldn't care less that  the  pork chop wasn't fit to eat.   $23.00 down the drain.
Excellent food - highly recommended. Nice staff and comfortable seating and decor make this restaurant a can't miss if you are looking for something other than typical burgers, fries, and tacos.

Pretty place took a friend for lunch. Restaurant has no lunch menu but extensive choices to pick from.  Staff was warm and attentive.  Two dishes ordered chicken curry and clay pot salmon.  Both came with a little salad and a broth soup. We enjoyed our meals. I feel a bit pricey for lunch, with tip almost $40.00.

My husband and I go here for pho when we are in the area and its well worth the trip. The pho is always delicious and boith is so flavorful! We have never got any other entree other than pho, but tempted after seeing the pictures on yelp. For drinks, try the coconut drink or lemon soda, both very good! Be careful, it's not free refills, but I usually drink about two. For appetizers, the shrimp eggs rolls and spring rolls are very good choices.

Here with two non-foodies, my parents. THey settled for Americanized food while I asked for the most authentic items they had. While I can't speak to the authenticity, the flavors were delicious. There were no leftovers, even for my parents. That means two things. Not too much food served and the flavors made us finish. In fact, I really, really cleaned my plate. I would go back.
It was my first time there and the service and food was fantastic! Had the Pho Ga which was reasonably priced and incredibly delicious. Some of the best food in Surprise, AZ.

The place looked closed but I parked and went in anyway.....first mistake. No one else there....warning!   Nothing looked good to me so I ordered eggrolls to go. About the size of my finger, and no filling. BUT they were extra well done....yuk.

Saigon kitchen is one of the few restaurants that I would never return to, if I could rate it a no star I would. The owner was the rudest person ever!!! Their restaurant was completely dead, and they have a B for their sanitation grade. Don't waste your money or time.

The food was great service was not too bad. However only thing that shocked me was the prices. For a moment I though I was in Scottsdale. Everything is a lot higher then normal pho place the portion was kinda small as well.
Love this place for their shrimp and garlic noodles. And their spring rolls are top notch. The peanut sauce you dip them in is killer.

I love Saigon Kitchen. For a while, we were heading there every weekend. It had just gotten too crazy though with all the snowbirds. I hate driving down Bell rd this time of year. So we havent gone in a while and having been ordering take out from Pholicious.  But that does not mean it isn't good. Its is great. I love the atmosphere. It is more upscale and classy compared to most Vietnamese places. It also has an interesting menu with so many things I want to try. I just can't not order Pho though. It is so tasty and healthy. I feel like a better person when I order pho. The pho here is great. It comes out fresh and hot, tons of veggies. My husband gets the pho thair and he loves it.  He actually prefers this place over pho tahn because it is classier. I like the pho better at the other place, but will go to either one. They are both about the same distance from my house. Plus this one has beer and drinks.  The service is always excellent. The staff is very friendly and loves our baby. They always make sure she is comfortable there. My only complaint is that they charge a lot for the small side of rice we give her.   It is fun going to Surprise and seeing all the snow birds trying this place. At first they are a little nervous, and get the simple things on the menu that are familiar. Then I see them looking at my soup. They always ask us what it is and say they are going to order it next time, and they are so happy they decided to try this place even though it was "different" and "not their usual". So go on Surprise snowbirds, try Saigon Kitchen, don't be scared, its fresh healthy and delicious. Try the pho!

Came here for quick lunch. Beautiful decor but the food was lack of flavor. The waitress was nice, but I wish they have better food, so sorry to give you 2 stars.  I ordered shrimp fried rice and it came with broth soup. The fried rice was average and the broth soup was sweet, I didn't eat it.

One of my favorite restaurants in surprise! Service is always wonderful, everyone is kind. The garlic noodles are a must have, firecracker shrimp is awesome, shaken beef is delicious! All the appetizers are super good! No complaints with this place!

We had a party of six and arrived at 5:30. Good thing we had reservations because the place was happening. Our server Josh was great..we had our drinks, appetizers and our entrees. Everything came out hot and flavorful. ..the surf and turf with filet mignon beef was outstanding. Next time we'll probably sit at the bar for dinner. Highly recommend this restaurant.

My feelings on this restaurant are a little split...so let's just get into it.   Being in Surprise I understand that prices are going to be on the higher side. So, that is a downfall.   The food was good, just good. Not fantastic or anything I would be craving for. I ordered the small bowl of pho dac biet which was okay but lacking the real depth of the beef flavor. Hubby order the firecracker shrimp with garlic noodles (which I do recommend)   I noticed that there wasn't traditional Vietnamese fare such as banh xeo, soybean milk, and the rice plates did not offered shredded pork or meatloaf.   All in all, food was good. If you're looking to try some ethnic food that is a little easier on the western palate this is the place to try. However,  if you want traditional "straight out of mama's kitchen" type food I would definitely make the drive the 17th Ave and Camelback to Pho Thanh.

Great, if it weren't so damn expensive for Vietnamese food.  9 dollars for a bowl of pho is nerve racking for someone that's used to 5 dollars a bowl.  I will say this though, the food is excellent and the presentation is unlike any other vietnamese restaurant I have encountered.  A nice hotspot for the general public, and with it's monopoly over West Phoenix, it's a sorely needed treat and that 9 dollar bowl of noodles doesn't seem that expensive anymore.

This place is the most outstanding restaurant in surprise! The owner Dennis has done it right on so many levels! The food is so delicious and it never ever disappoints! Bring your whole family here!! You have to ask for Kathy or Steven to be your order! They're the OG's and know how to give you a great dining experience.
A good little Vietnamese restaurant.  Young servers in a hip atmosphere.  Good music looming in the air.  I'll be back.  They need to serve brown rice and to upgrade their pepper tray.

We really like this restaurant. Husband and I went there for our anniversary. The food is quite good. Our biggest complaint is the service, though the staff is attentive the courses come too closely together. We didn't have time to eat one course before the next course came. We've had this issue in previous visits as well. We would like to have time to eat the appetizer before the salad comes. We just ask the the staff wait a beat before bringing out the next course.

Wow, this is good stuff. First off, I entered to pick up my carry-out order, and I was greeted with a handshake and friendly faces. My food was ready, I was promptly served and I was on my way out within 3 minutes of walking through the door. My usual order in the valley is rice vermicelli with pork (Bun Thit Nuong) but I was pleased to see that Saigon Kitchen offers charbroiled chicken as well. This is a HUGE plus for me, as many other locations only offer shrimp, pork or egg rolls. The chicken was very good. The flavors weren't quite as marinated as I'd hoped and it was a touch on the greasy side (because it /is/ dark meat), but the flavor and texture were overall very good. The portion size is appripriate; I had enough to fill me.... and I generally eat a lot. I would've preferred more peanuts and pickled carrots on top, but that's nitpicking. Their fish sauce is one of the best I've tasted. I have to try their spring rolls and other standard Vietnamese items another time, but if you want a very good meal, the Bun Ga Nuong is an excellent selection.

Had Shaken Beef for lunch, delicious! The server was great and explained to me how to eat the dish. I had no idea Vietnamese food was so good. A little pricy for lunch, but it was good.   I was a bit concerned about one of the staff members drinking on the job when I watched him mix a cocktail behind the bar and then proceed to share a taste with my server. Guess when the owner is out there's no one really in charge in front of the house.  My first impression was "what is that smell?" Not sure if it was dirty water or rags used on the tables or the food/sauces being cooked in the back. I couldn't smell it after being in the place for a while.   The owner came in, personable guy and the staff shaped up. Overall not a bad experience and I would come back, with friends to dine with.

This is a fast food Asian restaurant with a lot of sugar and oil to satisfy fat midwestern  appetites.   Way too much of both for the sophisticated palette.  If this place were cheap, no foul.  But it's not.  Everyone has an opinion; this is mine.

My favorite Vietnamese restaurant. Very nice and classy spot with excellent food. Favorites: fillet mignon pho, shaken beef filet mignon, and shrimp spring rolls. Had the chocolate lava cake with ice cream today for the first time today. DELISH!

Surprise may be a bit of a drive from Phoenix or Scottsdale, but if you are in the West Valley and craving Asian food, Saigon Kitchen is the place to go.  A clean, modern and somewhat trendy look/feel, with an open bar in the middle of the restaurant.  Amazing appetizers, entres and service.  Order the Stir Fry and you won't regret it.  This hidden gem will be my new go-to.

I don't usually give a five star review but this is the best of the best in our growing town of Surprise.  I have eaten there twice now and I can't wait to go back. First time we ate at the bar and it was very busy so we had to wait longer than usual for our food.  I had the cornish game hen and it was falling off the bone delicious. Service is good & I like the modern decor of the restaurant.  Next visit I invited four friends to join us for dinner and much to my surprise everyone was happy.  It is hard to please everyone!  I had the garlic noodles and they were divine.  We need more restaurants like this in Surprise.  Next I'm going to try the Shaken Beef.

This is my favorite restaurant in the West Valley. It is beautiful and upscale. The food is truly excellent. For instance, I order the fillet mignon and onion entree and although it is expensive, it is really a sliced fillet and done just the way you want it. Extremely tender too. I also love the spring rolls. Lots of variety. Try them all. The peanut sauce is great. Last month I brought 12 neighbors.  They all loved it. Service is great. Don't miss this place. Best Asian food in town and maybe the whole Phoenix area.
Wow, the Shaken Beef dinner was amazing. Really out of this world good. Make sure to get there during happy hour and get good prices on appetizers and drinks. The Spring Rolls were exceptional.

The food is delicious for dine-in, but if you are in a rush, this is not the place to order take-out.  I have a half an hour lunch, so I ordered well ahead of time and noted that time I would be there to pick up the food.  The food was ready on time, but it took them 20 minutes to make change.  I am not kidding!  By the time I got back to work, I didn't have time to eat.    The employees weren't allowed to open the cash register, so they made change using the money they had in their pockets and coins in a cup.  They had to fish through the cup to get out the correct change.  The waiter who was taking my money didn't have the correct change in his pocket, so he had to go get another employee to help him!
First time here tonight. The filet Mignon entree was amazing. Service was fast. Enjoyable and affordable.

Really excellent AUTHENTIC Vietnamese run by a super friendly family.  The food was so fresh and pure I felt I was eating in their living room and not a restaurant, which is about the highest compliment I can give. Obviously, this place has caught on as it was Thursday dinner and people just kept coming in and coming in at this small, well decorated restaurant.  Seems they have tons of regulars eating there, too, after speaking with several people and seeing how many were greeted so warmly by the waiters. The food is fresh, authentic and delicious.  I had the shaken steak dinner and ordered calimari and spring roll appetizers.  Needless to say, this was just way too much food, and I ended up bringing some home.   My friend ordered fried rice with shrimp, and it was the best fried rice I have ever tasted.  Loved it! This is one of the best places I have ever eaten at on the West side, and definitely worth the trip.  The food is great, service is great, place is clean and cute...what's not to love?  My friend and I both said we want to return here...and soon.

OK, gave in to my desire to have great food again, Saigon Kitchen, Called for Reservations for Six at Six. got there the place was busy and my table was ready, tried food off the NEW Menu and it was just as Awesome as ever. the Rack of Lamb was raved over, Shrimp was really great as well as the noodles, Shaken Beef and Seafood Platter. The Service was excellent and as I could see all table were well attended. I may have been a little harsh on my first review on 2/6/16 but was a little upset. It is great to have a superior place to enjoy on this side of the Phoenix! Great Job Dennis! I believe you have the place under control.  Everyone enjoyed the meal ( As well as the dessert)

We've been coming here a while now. What used to be one of Surprise's best kept dining secret is no longer much of a secret.  Why? Because, like many diners, every item I've had from the menu becomes a favorite dish. I literally have to force myself to try something different each time. Eventually I reckon I'll make it all the way through the menu.  Here's the hard part. Chef and owner Denis always puts some new amazing dish on the menu. Tonight's dish was rack of pork tenderloin with garlic noodles ($20). The pork was perfectly prepared and quite delicious. Hopefully it will make it onto the menu permanently.  More good news is the long awaited expansion is complete. The seating inside and out is easily doubled as is the bar.  This place rocks.
If you ever had authentic Vietnamese food, you'd know how bad this place is. Over priced, food not authentic. Poor service.
Pho was very good. Had the vegetarian version with tofu, mushrooms and bok choy. Also ordered sandwich with pate and other meats and it was good. Good happy hour and surprisingly beautiful decor.

This place is great for a light meal or big dinner. Me and my fiancé eat here often and today the owner introduced us to his new dish, the lamb and garlic noodles which was perfect. Never a disappointment.

This is my favorite place to eat at in Surprise! My husband and I go here almost weekly for their Pho! Their chicken Pho is soooo delicious! Another great thing to try there is the shrimp spring rolls. The peanut sauce really compliments it! We love this place because 1. the delicious Pho 2. The cleanliness 3.the contemporary, nice interior. I also appreciate that the owner is always present and actually knows what is going on in his restaurant. He seems to know a lot of his customers as I often see him interacting with them. Im not surprised that he has a lot of regulars because I have become one. I'm basically in love with this place!

This is my favorite place to eat.  Dennis the owner has turned this place into the best restaurant in the West Valley.  I love the flavors of all their food.  When new people are asking me what to get I said close your eyes and point with your finger.  It is all great no matter what you get.  They have some really nice holiday meals going on at the moment with Steak and Lobster, Grouper, and several other combinations.  They have a really nice happy hour as well with discounts on Apps and drinks.  All the servers treat me, well, better than my family treats me.  Always a happy place for me to go and get a great meal.  Come on over and you will find me with a smile sitting at the bar.
Excellent, Shaken beef, beef stew, Cornish hen, garlic noodles, crispy egg rolls and garlic butter edamame all rock!
Awesome!!! Surprise doesn't anything authentic......boy did we need this! Traditional and yummy!! Service is great and the atmosphere is relaxed and inviting!

Incredible food! If I still lived near Surprise I would probably be there right now, eating delicious pho, spring rolls, and calamari.   The owner and all of the people who work there are SO friendly and fun to be around. Sometimes I'd plan to get food to go, but when I got there and got talking with them all I found that I didnt want to leave.   Definitely a place to dine in, get to know everyone, and enjoy the best vietnamese food in all of the Phoenix Area!
Still the BEST restaurant in Surprise!!!  Had the 86 Banana for dessert tonight   LOVE IT!!!

This has become our favorite restaurant in town. We've also had friends jump on the Saigon Kitchen bandwagon as well. Tonight was our second dinner here this week alone. Our service was fabulous. The food was fantastic.  We love the pho (both the steak and the chicken), the spring rolls, the crispy egg rolls, both the lemongrass beef and chicken, the garlic noodles, and the salmon. We can't wait to go back and try something else next time.  I'm sure our list of favorites will only grow.  One benefit to being in a town like Surprise is that a lot of chains don't see us as a good market (thank goodness) which is perfect for these wonderful independents to come in.  Saigon Kitchen is a gem and a welcome addition to our community!  We'll be back soon!

Saigon Kitchen has the best Asian food in Indian Trail! Try the Pho Beef. I was in Chicago's Chinatown recently and the food at Saigon rivals  the food I had there.  The business is locally and family-owned.

After pulling in front of the shop. I'll admit, we were hesitant to turn around and go to our usual pho joint BUT we gave it a try. Looks can be deceiving so don't be quick to judge this tiny gem.   This restaurant appears to be a mom and pop shop. With that being said, don't expect anything too grand when it comes to the pho. It's simple yet, I admire it. I like simplicity. It reminds me of something my mom or myself would throw together when making a quick pho. There are only two options, chicken pho or beef with meatball pho. Go with the beef and meatball. To me, it's a lot better than other places I've tried.  Spring rolls were the usual. It's the usual good. Their strawberry boba taste more of a strawberry smoothie but I'm not complaining. It taste as if fresh strawberries were used instead of the typical flavored powders. They only offer strawberry, green tea, or taro. There may be one other flavor but I cannot recall at the moment.   This place would be perfect for a quick bite of pho. Or for anyone passing through and are hungry. Also, CPCC students or teachers may find this place as a good choice to grab lunch or dinner as its nearby the Levine campus.   I would personally revisit. The staff were kind and sweet.
Best Asian food place to eat in Surprise!  The garlic noodles are a must. The shaken beef is always ordered by either my wife or myself.

Tried SK for the first time last weekend.  We had just returned from San Francisco so our culinary expectations might have been skewed... My husband had Com Dac Biet and I had Bun Ga Nuong.  Both were good.  Not exceptional or outstanding, but good, filling.  I thought my vermicelli was slightly too cold upon being served, it kinda stuck together, but once I gave it a stir in the fish sauce, which was very good, and got them to loosen up, they were pretty tasty.  Both dishes were very light on flavor and really lacked any spice, heat, or tickle to the tongue... I think this is known as bland... Yet not completely bland, I'd say blandish...  We had Cha Glo Tom as a starter and this was the highlight of our meal!  Because these were so darn good we had very high expectations  for our main dishes and were disappointed... Like I said, blandish... Especially in comparison to the starter and the culinary whirlwind we experienced in SF... But hey, it's a Phoenix suburb in a disgusting economy, so yes, we will dine at Saigon Kitchen again because it's as close as we can get...  I look forward to trying the Pho...

Very happy!  Food is homemade and top notch.  Even potato chips are homemade.  We wanted a light lunch so we split one sandwich between 2 people and it was enough.  Then the 6 of us chose 6 pastries/desserts and sampled all    around.    My favorite was the key lime tart.  The sandwiches are around $8, and total cost of  pastries was under $15 (buy five get one free!).  We paid a total of about $50, same as eating hamburgers, waaay better food!!  I think it is ridiculous that someone gave 2 stars for the birthday cake.  If it looks beautiful when you pick it up and it tastes delicious you shouldn't blame the establishment for not getting it home intact.

Ate at the bar, food was exceptional! Sat next to the owner who gave us recommendations and we took him up on them. I had the filet mignon pho and it was so,so good! My husband had Saigon fried rice and I think it was even better than what I had.  We loved this place the moment we walked in. It's decorated very nicely and super clean. Thumbs up!

We have been dining here since they opened.  Last night we decided to try two new appetizers that Dennis told us about.....they were excellent!  We had the salt and pepper shrimp which was very flavorful and the sweet and sour wings which were a different way of serving wings.  This new twist on wings won us over!  We will definitely order these two appetizers again. Jim and Cheryl
The pho was really greasy and flavorless. We had the coconut bubble tea and it was very watered down. Overall, not a great experience. We won't be returning here.

Does anyone else feel like their reviews disappear sometimes on Yelp? It's so weird. I've been a few times to Saigon Kitchen once with just my husband and again with the entire family. It's a bit pricey so I prefer the two of us ha ha ha. Anyways if you are a big pho lover then I recommend the surf and turf pho. The portion is huge and they will tell you that, but it's great to take home. My only negative thing is that this time it was all surf...where was the turf? No meet at all. It took quite a while to get our food so I wasn't about to send it back. The appetizers did safe my life though. If you're looking for a date night this is a nice little place with great decor and dim lighting without having g to travel to downtown Phoenix.

So glad that I we came here for lunch. We tried spring rolls they were so refreshing and light. Perfect appetizer. Then on to my lunch....I tried shaken beef with garlic yakisoba type noodles. This was bomb. The beef was so tender and well seasoned a a sauce that makes my mouth water as I write this review.  My friend had the pork lunch special which came with a bowl of soup salad and rice. I give both these plates a thumbs up big time. Service was outstanding. I did notice they had alot of regulars. I do like to see this. There is inside and outside seating. The only thing that killed me was my plate was 16 dollars. I had to try what everyone was talking about on yelp. It was worth it to me. Sometimes it's ok to treat myself lol. What made this lunch nice was that I enjoyed it with good company. I will definitely be back.

Ugh. That's about all I can say about this place. I was VERY excited when I saw that they were opening a Vietnamese restuarant in the Surprise area, I'd previously had to drive an additional 30 minutes to get my pho fix. Because there's a lot of cons to this place, I'm just going to break it down into a list:  Pros: -good location (Surprise) -ample parking -clean, modern restaurant -nice bar seating, TVs to watch sports -sells their own "infused" liquors, which I haven't tried  Cons: -pho is disappointing. The rare beef soup was oddly flavored (like something out of a box) and the beef was stringy and not tender at all.  -STAY AWAY FROM THE SPRING ROLLS. They are the WORST I've ever had. The pork was dry (like, crunchy dry) and the shrimp was not chilled, but room temperature. The rolls had too much mint, were not well put together and warm. I literally was sick after eating these.   Given that I've been there on 3 separate occasions and have left twice without finishing my meal, I seriously doubt that I will be giving them another chance. I'm a serious fan of Vietnamese and other East Asian cuisine and this place, quite simply, does not cut it.
Unique place with really really good food. I like that it is a smaller setting and the people are friendly.  Reasonable prices too.

I've been waiting for this place to open so we could have a place in Surprise to eat other than the chain trash eateries. I had the egg rolls which were crispy and delicious. I also had the Pho which was hot and delicious. Service was good, prices reasonable. I will definitely eat here again.

Excellent service. The food is fresh and enjoyable. I would like it cooked spicy instead of adding spices after it is cooked and served. The place is very clean. I was amazed there was not more customers. The staff is very friendly too. We really appreciated everything. Cathy was excellent. Sit in her section.

The best restaurant in Surprise hands down.   Food is amazing, make sure you try the garlic noodles. Prices are high. Too high in my opinion, however I still find myself here a lot. Their Pho is some of the best ive had. The owner and staff is very friendly. This place gets packed. Expect a wait weekends at 6.  Its next to pei wei, which given the price different and quality difference really doesnt make them direct competition.

I'm not a big fan of fusion cuisine. I find these places artificial. However, this is just my personal taste. If I have to judge the restaurant, I can say the food was very well prepared, the staff was very friendly and attentive, the owner came to talk to us to ask us about our trip. The only things I didn't like are the lack of chopsticks (but then again this is part of the fusion thing) and the salted caramel ice cream was not very tasty. My friend loved this restaurant, I was more like "it's okay", so we'll even it at 4 stars :)

Was recently visiting PHX, and stopped here for dinner.  Being a fan of Pho, I ordered the Pho Tai.  Believe me when I tell you that this was a ne of the best bowls I've ever had.  Pho is all about the broth, and Saigon's is terrific.    Was so impressed, that I returned the next day for lunch, when I enjoyed their braised pork Banh Mi.  Wonderful.
The best Vietnamese restaurant in Arizona. Clean and modern look. Food is fresh and tasty. My husband and I go there quite often and the the kids like the garlic noodles.
Our go to spot for Pho if we're trying to stay local. A bit pricey compared to others I've been to but the service makes up for it. Try the Vietnamese sandwiches.

The sizzling beef and seafood, along with the garlic noodles and short ribs are AMAZING!!!  You won't be disappointed and should go right now!  Love visiting this place every time I'm in town. Great service, friendly staff and fantastic food.

This place is okay. We have have gone there many times. Almost every time we have been completely satisfied with our choices. This time I have to say that it wasn't their  best. Service good, noise level better. My wife's salmon was perfect. I myself tried the Viennese Ribs. Okay one more thing off the list. I guess I am use to good old American ribs. To me no flavor. Salads were sort of wimpy.  I think we'll take a break from going there. Maybe after the first of the year will try again.

Got the surf and turf pho that everyone was raving about. It was meh, ok. Not horrible, not amazing either. It was very basic and didn't have any favors that would separate it from every other place. Now the fried shrimp appetizer, that was good. I wouldn't come here for pho though. I'm gonna keep trying to find an amazing restaurant that makes it right!

This place continues to impress me. I LOVE the Shaken Beef and their Combination Pho. I don't think I need to go to any other place when looking for Vietnamese food. The best part? It is here in the town of Surprise! Great service, great food and so glad to see that business is going so well that they could expand the restaurant! Congrats Saigon Kitchen! My wife and I and quite a number of our friends love you!

Anyone that knows great Vietnamese food knows that Viet fare is affordable, with a kick of fish sauce and a background from Cambodia, Thailand, France and Laos. I went to order a traditional Bahn Mi...look, I am a not a cheap ass but NINE FREAKING DOLLARS for a sandwich made me laugh. Really? Should be $3.25. Just like they are everywhere else. I understand the monopoly and the game but come on....that is a disgrace and disrespectful by all means. Not even good, not worth it, not worth a second chance....bummer.

Sometimes I just don't feel like driving up to Le's to get a Banh Mi - maybe it is because I really don't want to get the car aligned for a sandwich, no matter how good that sandwich might be. Plus, some places are just closer. So we'll pop on over to Saigon Kitchen.  Even better is you can get a nice bowl of pho to go along with your sandwich, or if you are feeling like something else entirely, you can go off in that direction instead. Plenty of options on the menu, and the staff has always been very welcoming and will help you choose a dish that fits your mood.  Not much to look at from the outside, but well worth a stop!

Great food.  We were there on a Saturday evening and it was very busy. However, we were able to get a table four 4 adults and 2 children.  Ordered the chicken wings with the house sauce, outstanding for the appetizer.  Just enough to take off the hunger edge.  My daughter in low ordered the Lemongrass chicken, she said it was very good.m Son ordered the shrimp dinner with rice and pho soup and salad, hubby had the BBQ Pork, shrimp and sausage fried rich, outstanding he said!  Ii had the shrimp stir fry, also outstanding.  We enjoyed it so much and would order the same except we all want to try a different entree when we come back.  Suggest the Lemon Soda as a drink, our grandson had it and it was very tasty.  It was made from scratch with real lemons.  Great place to go in the Northwest Phoenix Valley.
Love this place, shaken beef is amazing,  garlic noodles with shrimp is very good as well, little on the pricy side but nice treat once in a while. Faith the manager is awesome. ..
Best Vietnamese in the valley! The service is always really great, and the food is amazing. Always fresh and flavorful. Love that we live so close, but would drive and distance for this place.

This place is incredible.  Best Filet Mignon I've ever had, the sauce is unbelievable.  Shrimp spring rolls were amazing.  The bartender and owner were super friendly, I noticed they knew around a half-dozen of their customers by name.  Casual atmosphere, full bar with flatscreens, nice decor.

Oh yes. Went here while visiting relatives in AZ. Amazing food, excellent service.   What I really liked is that in an indie restaurant like this you get people that really seem happy to be working there as opposed to corp-chain restaurants. They know what they are serving, and they know they are serving great food.  Started with the crispy egg rolls - these are the famous egg rolls that are delicious - wrap them in the lettuce & mint for a proper treat. Then had the Specialty pork ribs - key here is eat them while hot (made the mistake of talking instead of eating). Finished with the Filet Mignon Shaken Beef - which were, well yes, amazing.  Here's a hint - order the soup. The waiter kind of downplayed the soup as being very simple. Well, it may look simple, but the flavors just exploded in a great way. When we told the waiter how much we loved it, he explained the ingredients and process of making - and it all made sense.

Surprise!  A Vietnamese restaurant in Surprise.  I ordered bun noodles with beef/lemongrass to go.  I waited at the bar, and the service was great.  The owner sat next to me and had a plate of spring rolls.  I made a comment on how tasty they looked, and he asked if I wanted one.  I think that's when I knew I loved this place.  Anyhow, I got home and tasted my food.  Awesome.  The noodles were cooked perfectly (not soggy), and there were plenty of veggies and meat.  The nuoc mam had a lot of flavor as well. (You can have really good food, but if you have crappy nuoc mam, your food won't taste right.)  I think I'm gonna have to start ordering to-go weekly.

After the eating debacle last night I was ecstatic when we pulled up to the parking lot here. Tried to get in last night. Way too long a wait. Could have been because it was Sunday night. Didn't face that issue tonight.  Cozy and stylish, we entered the restaurant famished to a person. One of us diners is local and threw out what he likes to order best when eating here. Two of us took his suggestion and ordered the Filet Mignon Shaken Beef, as did he.  But first we had drinks. Beer for the guys. A lovely Ms. Margarita for me. Had a slight kick due to the jalapeño, but not overwhelming. The basil made it taste nice and light. Very refreshing. The signature dishes are served with soup as well as salad, and we also ordered two types of spring rolls - shrimp, and pork. The rolls were fresh, enhanced by the peanut sauce. Nice sauce, just the right amount of sweetness. My cohort is not a salad guy, but really enjoyed it with the dressing. His excuse was that it would allow him to order dessert. I like salad a lot and agreed with him. The soup was a Chicken Scallion Broth that left me wondering if that was the base for their pho. Hopefully I will get to find out before I leave Surprise.  Then our main courses arrived. The Filet Mignon Shaken Beef comes on a sizzling plate, served with Jasmine rice. Josh had asked how we wanted the steak cooked and it was perfection on a skillet, with lots of grilled onions abounding and around. I was getting full at this point, but also pretty happy because I don't have wheels here and was already anticipating the leftovers for tomorrow.  The dining companion who didn't have steak ordered another signature entree - Saigon Garlic Noodles. He stated that the pork was tender and the noodles were yummy. He also couldn't finish his meal as the two pork chops were huge.  Needless to say we could not swing dessert. All the more reason to return this week. Just to put it in perspective, I love food but not crazy about writing reviews. Had a ten hour work day and am looking forward to curling up for a long sleep after a shower tonight. But I had to write this! Two thumbs up and a few curled toes. Not to be missed when in Surprise.  Simple, clean eating grub.

We stop here every time we come out to Phx..Sun City West to visit because it past my wife's taste test....She is picky, born in Asia and her mom is the best cook in the neighborhood, she know her food. We load up everything and usually get some to go for the day after. Very busy but not to busy. The only draw back we found was lots of staff but we had to flag down a waitress for service....w/ so much staff I was surprised no one picked up on a waiting customer. Overall it was great food...hot and tasty and will always stop in when we are in town.

I was in today with my 77 year old mother who has zero experience with Vietnamese food and my knowledge is limited. Our server was helpful and gave great descriptions of the food, didn't just say, "this is our most popular item." And, he was very well spoken in a world full of "umm" and "like", it was refreshing. A little grammar and enunciation goes a long way!     On top of the lovely service and respectfully decorated spotless interior, the food was AMAZING! Everything we ordered was delicious. Clay pot salmon was a tasty surprise. The Saigon garlic Noodle with beef was tender and the sweetness of the garlic noodle unexpected. The crispy egg roll with the mint and sweet vinegar sauce was excitedly different and thoroughly enjoyed.   We will return often. In the Bell Road sea off chain restaurants this is a gem.
We had a group of eight friends that went. Food was fabulous! Service was fabulous! We all had great food and a good time. Will definitely go again.

This is by far the very best place to eat in the surprise area. We have been enjoying the special recipes that Dennis creates for years and are never disappointed.  The food is fabulous, the service excellent. Our favorite is the shaken beef and seafood bruschetta.

We Frequent here about every two weeks. They have a great Happy Hour. The Wait Staff is Nice and helpful. It's always very clean which I LOVE. I really like the Filet Mignon Salad, Rice Noodles (Vermicelli) with Chicken, All their spring rolls are delicious and I usually have a Ginger Fizz..as far as cocktails go it's my favorite.We also like their Pho but it's been to hot lately to enjoy it. Sunday's are great to visit this place as it's usually not busy between 3-5. We've been on a Friday night and it's just really busy and loud. But if that's something your ok with enjoy!
Good selection of dishes on the menu. Service was great. Happy Hour has a nice selection of drinks and apps.

What an amazing place.  My wife and I shared some crispy egg rolls as our appetizer, for our main course she got the chicken fried rice and I got the shaken beef.  I can't believe how tender the beef was and the onions to black pepper ratio was amazing.  I noticed people expressed concern for the small amount of the chili sauce they give you; they now give you the whole bottle.  My wife liked it so much she said she wants to meet her father here later in the week.

Very nice décor and friendly staff, especially the owner who repeatedly came by the table to make sure all was well.  Vietnamese food was very well done. (Bun, and combination plate)  A bit pricey for the serving size ($14/each) Aug 2015 update     Food still good BUT no lunch menu so pricey for lunch
Try the rice noodles with cured pork...delicious and light...my husband thinks they are a little slow on service (even for take out) but the food is totally worth it!
Nice, casual, yet classy joint. Everything is absolutely delicious. The chicken pho is my favorite! Pay the extra dollar for the large for lunch the next day.

The place was a lot fancier than I expected. I'm used to kind of run down Vietnamese places but this place is nice. The servers were friendly. One of them actually just had a casual conversation with me while i waited which was refreshing.  He requested that I get the Shaken Beef? So I did and it was really good. I got my food to go so I couldn't really experience the whole atmosphere of the place. I will definitely be back again to try something else. (The guy next to me got an order of pho that smelled heavenly...)

Wow, yet another amazing restaurant, how come that does not "Surprise" me, coming from the "Sister" restaurant "Rice Paper". Dropped in last night to see what the buzz was about and ordered the Fillet & Jumbo Shrimp with fresh lemon grass which was made with perfection with a perfectly balanced dipping sauce served with a side of rice, a small bowl of the pho soup stock and a tasty side salad. Dennis and Hue brought out  a  Cornish Game hen that was crispy on the outside and tender and juicy on the inside, these culinary marvels don't mess around!!! and of course it also came with a wonderful dipping sauce. Both dishes were superb not to mention the hospitality from Dennis the proprietor who tells me he only  uses the freshest ingredients and boy your palate sure notices the difference. The food quality exceeds the price of the menu, I would pay double for the quality given here. Saigon Kitchen you have a customer for life here, can't wait to bring my family in here. Looks like Saigon Kitchen and Rice Paper are my home away from home now!!!!
Pork on shrimp crackers, fantastic, will come back just for those. Saigon shaken beef was great.

The problem with restaurants like this is when you have tried authentic Vietnamese food and there is a huge disparity in taste and quality. Sorry, but after trying their food twice, we will never come back again. It's a short drive to Pholicious or Old Glendale's Little Saigon, so we will just keep going to those two.

This is my favorite restaurant for Vietnamese food. They have the best chicken Pho and the crispy egg rolls are too die for! I personally like eating them with the lettuce wrapped around them. The only negative thing I have to say is I think it's a little spendy but will totally pay the price because the food is so good.
Everything has always been fantastic! Staff are friendly and attentive. Went last night and had the holiday special cherry chocolatini. Would order that again. Please keep it on the menu!!!

One of the best restaurants in Surprise!! Always an excellent experience. The menu is extensive including Pho and many other traditional Vietnamese dishes. Service is great the waiting staff is wonderful the atmosphere is always welcoming. The Vietnamese coffee is a delightful treat.

We stopped in recently for a late evening dinner, on the recommendation of a colleague.  Thank you, Tim, we loved it!  The food was fresh and delicious, the staff were friendly and accommodating.  I left wishing I lived nearby and not 6 hours away in San Diego.  My final wrd on Saigon Kitchen is Yummmm.....!

The server we had was very friendly and super helpful to me when I let him know I was vegetarian. He double checked that they had vegetarian broth available before he confirmed to me that they had what I could eat.  The vegetarian pho, which you have to specify you want vegetable broth because it will come with chicken or beef broth if you don't, was pretty good. It was a tiny bit more bland than I am used to, but with jalapeño and lime it was perfect.  I will definitely go back next time I want Pho!

Fun little place with good noodle bowls.  Had some family in town and we hit this restaurant together.  Food is good and the staff is friendly.  They were all young and sometimes forgot to check on drinks and finished dishes, but they did circle back and were kind.  Broth for the Pho was rich and savory.  Garnishes were good, but could have been more flavorful.  Other noodle bowls were yummy.  One odd thing was two people ordered the same dish and one had a lot more egg roll in it than the other.    The Saigon Chicken Wings were a new an cool twist on a traditional appetizer.  Pot stickers were pretty good, as well.  Good value overall.

Had to wait 45 minutes to be seated for a group of 5, which is understanding, since it was a busy night. After being seated an getting our orders taken, it took them almost an hour for them to deliver our food to our table, by this time it was almost closing time. A couple of people ordered chicken pho, which takes only 15 minutes to cook. I and a couple others ordered simple meat dishes. I got the shrimp curry and they only give me 7 pieces of shrimp with a side of cold rice. Really!? If the owner can't cook rice or how to keep a dish warm why is he even in the kitchen? Leave it to the professionals. After we complained of our issues, they sent over a bus boy pretending to be a manager. However, he gave excuses and didn't act upon them. Really showed incompetence and lack of any type of managerial skills. I would not recommend this place, considering incompetent employees, unskilled owner, and lack of quality service.

Update review... Just went here on a busy Friday and became not a fan...  I did order my norm, combo plate.  Pork cube, pork chop, and shrimp.  Note I always ask to replace the shrimp with chicken.  I cannot eat shellfish and I assume chicken is less than shrimp.  To my surprise they wanted to up charge for the swap?  The waiter said he would have to talk to the manager to do the swap with no up charge.   I also noted the manager talking up charge to another customer that wanted to substitute the noodles for another type of noodle.   To top of the experience, another group of customers asked for a bus boy to clean their table.  After waiting for a good 10 minutes they left?   Maybe they were having a bad night of service?  Another issue I had was once I did get my main course I was not given a steak knife to cut the pork chop on the plate.  Once I did flag down someone, I was told that they had to grab a knife from the kitchen and had no steak knifes and the normal knifes cannot cut the pork chop? I have put Saigon kitchen on the bottom of places I would visit now that I have experienced poor service on this visit.  Not only me, but it was noted around me and it is not often I am at a restaurant and customers leave because of lack of attention.   Fix the customer service, up charge, and get some knifes to cut what you serve.  Wish the owners were there.  I always experience great customer service when they are present, I use to love this place.

The food is good. We come here for the pho because it's close by. The restaurant is small and there aren't many tables so I wouldn't go there hungry on a crowded day without reservations. Call to go orders in an hour before planning to pick it up. Waiting area to be seated is small and kind of awkward, I hope they get a bigger facility to accommodate for how popular they seem to be.

Tough- in between a 3 and a 4. Probably try something else first so put it at a 3.   Atmosphere is good. Service is good.   Price is a expensive.   Food is quite well cooked, delicious, a little bit too salty but I like it.   Garlic noodles with the shrimp ($2extra for veggies) and the egg rolls were excellent.

Service was great, location is prime and food was very good. I ordered a bowl of noodles with grilled shrimp and enjoyed it very much. I also had some veggie rolls and they were tasty. Server did a great job.

Came here to try their much talked about Pho but settled on something else.  Nonetheless, this place was Pho-nomenal!  Location & Aesthetics - located on Bell Road (corner of Bell and Litchfield) between Longhorn Steakhouse and Carrabba's. It might be easy to miss from Bell Road because what you see from Bell Road is the rear of some (not all) of the restaurants as their facades face south.  The sign to the restaurant is large enough from Bell Road so I'm thinking you won't miss it.  Even if you miss it while traveling west, it's not a problem and very easy to make a U-turn on Bell as there are enough U-turn options available on the road. Lots of parking in the rear, and the parking lot was well lit. The interior of the restaurant is well-lit if you're dining in the evening as we were, and I'm guessing if you're dining in for lunch too, you won't have a problem as the restaurant is surrounded with glass windows.  There is also the option to dine alfresco at the side of the restaurant. Normally I would minus a point here as the restaurant was on the small side and felt cramped however the owner - Dennis did come around and happened to introduce himself to us, asked how we knew of the place and picked it (told him Yelp of course!), as well as indulged in some small talk, and did mention that he was expanding the place by taking over the space next door which will be occurring mid-December to sometime in January, and even extended a personal invitation for us to attend the grand re-openinging. The place was also exceptionally clean.  The noise level was average as it was a Friday evening but wasn't overly loud that I couldn't hear anyone in my party. Despite the place being really busy for a Friday evening, I didn't notice anyone having to wait for seating.  Service/Menus - menus were provided to us as by our waitress soon as we were seated.  Very easy to read and understand.  Even our questions were answered promptly.  Our waitress took our drink orders immediately and gave us time to think about what we wanted to order.  Drinks came promptly and our waitress even saved us some money.  We came in a minute before happy hour was finished (3-6 PM).  Thankfully our waitress put in our drink and appetizer orders just in time so we ended up paying a little less (Happy Hour prices) for those items.  Food/Drinks - For libations, I ordered the orange martini which was delicious and not too tart.  For appetizers, we ordered the shrimp & pork spring rolls (2 and its cut in half so you end up having 4 bites) - lettuce, bean sprouts, rice vermicelli, and mint served with a peanut sauce dip - very tasty particularly the ingredients added to the rolls like the mint and bean sprouts which served to enhance the tastiness of the shrimp and pork.  The rice vermicelli also gave the rolls a particularly nice transparent appearance.   For the main course, I thought I was going to have the Pho but instead settled for the Filet Mignon Shaken Beef - which is seared cubed beef tenderloin marinated in their house special soy, and served on a sizzling skillet with onions.  When this part of the dish, came out, it was sizzling and I even had folks who were passing by asking me if I ever had this dish and commenting on how great it is, and it's the only thing they order when they're there.  By itself, the beef was tender, moist, juicy, and very flavorful.  The soy wasn't overpowering or too salty, and the onions were sautéed beautifully and not burnt at all.  They will ask you how you want the beef cooked, and for me it was medium, and it was done exactly like that!  It was also recommended by the wait staff to mix the lime and salt and pepper that comes with the dish first, then use that to dip the beef in (as an option) to enhance its flavor.  I tried it and they were correct in that it did seem to multiple the flavor(s) tenfold! This dish is also served with jasmine rice which was warm, fresh, sticky (as rice should be in my opinion) and very tasty; a side salad; and a scallion broth which was hot and just the right thing to clear those sinuses (though mine wasn't in need of clearing).  Well, my intentions were to come here to sample their Pho and despite that not happening, I don't have any regrets coming here at all.   As promised to the owner, I will return to try their Pho!
This place has great food! The caramelized salmon is too live for! Also the sizzling filet mignon is excellent. We also enjoyed the crispy eggrolls. Great place, give it a try!

The only good food we had all week. I was tired of the frozen stuff from my father in law's freezer & the stuff he got a deal on from Costco. I suppose where I was all week might have made this good taste especially good. But it was good. And the restaurant had an excellent vibe.

Just went last week and had a small bowl of pho and as always very delicious! I can't even finish the small side. It's big enough for two meals. Shredded chicken is always soft. Love this place! Best crunchy egg rolls!

My husband and I love this place. When it's date night, we know where we're going! Have dined several times and never had anything less than delish, but our favs are the shaken beef and the surf n turf pho.

The pho here was delicious!  We came with some friends who eat here regularly, and they did not disappoint. Starters were delicious too, and the tea was on point. Service was solid.  Zero complaints about stopping by this tasty place.

Resoundingly mediocre. Undercooked school lunch fries. They were supposedly flavored but the flavor seemed to have been misplaced on the way from the kitchen. I have had better flavored noodles from a top ramen box. Cocktail was syrupy sweet, wontons were greasy, shrimp was over cooked and tough. Nothing was completely inedible, but neither was it enjoyable.The Olive Garden of Asian food. Wait staff however was pleasant and friendly.

Very good spring rolls, Pho Beef Soup and the Lemon Grass Shrimp are to die for. Is a bit expensive but the atmosphere and the foods are definitely worth a try. Would give it a 5 for food, gave it a 4 because of price.

I suppose being on Check Please Arizona (PBS) raised expectations but I was disappointed.  On a positive note, our waitress was delightful however the food was so so. Fresh spring roll was tough, the chicken diced and the stir fry a but soggy.   I would go there again.    Every place can have an off day. We spent $60.00 for lunch - no alcohol.  Paula

I was trying to find places for Chinese food in Indian trail, I came across this place because of the good reviews. Unfortunately they didn't make the meal that I requested and made something they said I will like. The meal was okay, I wouldn't get it again, and I had to wait an extra 10 minutes for the meal. I was under the impression they didn't even have it made until I arrived, 30 minutes after I ordered.

Best place to eat in Surprise. The shaken beef is ridiculously good and the firecracker shrimp is a must. The pho is my comfort food, great to-go because they include all the condiments. The staff is great and since they expanded, there is rarely a wait. There isn't one thing about this place that I would change.

The place is small and a bit cramped. We chose to sit in the patio area which was quite nice, however, we were there for lunch and there were gardeners working only a few feet from us blowing dust everywhere! Not their fault the building owners scheduled gardening service at peak lunch hours I'm sure.  Aside from those minor complaints I loved the food and service was great! Our food was served in a timely manner, refills kept on coming, plates were cleared as needed and our waiter was very polite. He was also very knowledgeable about the menu and quick to answer any questions we had. Our portions were a good size and delicious! The spring rolls are on the appetizer list but were very filling by themselves. Overall it is a great place and we will definitely be back.

Wanted to find a good place for pho in the west valley and this was recommended. Ordered the filet mignon pho and the spring rolls and they were both great. One day decided to try something new and got the banh mi with everything on it. Damn good sandwich and worth the price. Great all around place.

I went to this restaurant with a couple of other people. They both ordered a salmon dish - one ordered the Sizzling Salmon and the other a very similar salmon dish, without the onions. I ordered Chicken Lemongrass, because I was in the mood for lemongrass.   First the Salmon (non-sizzling) arrived. It was quite warm temperature wise - both the food and the dish itself. A couple of minutes later, the Sizzling Salmon arrived - it was SIZZLING hot - the dish was HOT, the food was HOT.   I'm thinking - my lemongrass chicken will be steaming hot. A couple of minutes later - I'm not exaggerating there were several minutes between delivery of each of the meals. The lemongrass chicken was barely warm - BARELY WARM. I'd waited long enough, it was a couple of hours after I usually ate and I didn't complain. Well, not until this review. Did they not notice that ONE plate was sent out considerably colder than the other two and minutes later?   I've had good food here before and good service. However, I was not happy at all with that meal. I wouldn't choose this restaurant again - at least not for quite a while.   The outdoor seating is nice - I did notice that as I ate my delayed, barely warm food. Grrr.
The food and now the ambience makes this the Best Restaurant in Surprise! Flavor and creativity of dishes are spot on

I wish I could give them 0 stars. I have gone to this place plenty of times and always got the pho. I had been begging my mom to come with me to try the pho and finally one day she agrees. Well turns out none of us out of 4 got the pho but I did order something new to me, the curry shrimp. When ordering the waiter asked if I wanted it spicy since it is not spicy at all I said a little would be ok. My food comes out so spicy it made my eyes water and nose run. My mom decided to try some and was angry that i was eating it and insisted I say something. I told the waiter and he offered to bring me some extra sauce with no spice to help balance it. It didnt help much so I asked for a bit more to go and i would attempt to eat it at home since everyone else was done eating. The manager then tells him I have to pay for the extra sauce. So he offers me to speak to the manager and I do. The manager explains this is how much chili flakes is added to a mild meal and basically people have different opinions on spice level, as if I am just being a baby and my food is not that spicy. He also keeps asking "what do you want me to do there is nothing to do. I told the waiter extra sauce wont help" and starts arguing with my entire table. He was beyond rude I was in shock I had never heard anyone at a place of business speak like this to customers before it was obvious he didnt care about our business at all. He never apologized and did not care at all. It was clear I just had to deal with my inedible food. He made it look like I wanted a free meal, but I just wanted an apology some compassion, something. So we eventually paid and left after all the arguing was done. It was embarrassing and rude I was so excited to take my mom there and that is what happens. I will not return. Oh and the next day my mouth was actually sore from how hot the food was and I did not even finish it.

I came here because of a previous review I was looking to saves some money.  At first glance the restaurant didn't look like much, as its in a strip mall like many Chinese restaurants have with a few tables in.  They do have a lunch menu that starts at $5.99. The menu looked like Chinese so I thought maybe this wasn't Vietnamese at all.  So I ordered Chicken with mixed vegetables.  The cokes (store bought 16 oz) variety are 2 bucks.  The food was really good. It did have a Vietnamese style and flavor to it so I was pleased.  I finished the plate right off. You get enough for one person so no left overs.    I would probably come here again, but might get a cup of water next time to save the extra $2.  My total bill was $8.16 which wasn't too bad. Recommend.
Ridiculously amazing food, very friendly staff, and great suggestion for beer! Family and I will definitely be back in the near future! Keep up the great work!!

So we loved this place by haven't been there In awhile specifically because they are high dollar and little portions. However once in awhile we just go forming cause there lemongrass chicken was the bomb. But that is not the case now. We went there tonight and the bowl they put the chicken in had half the portion size from before and was cooked not so good. Ended up having to send it back and get something else. Was not the quality it once was that deemed it worthy of its high dollar low portion status. Sorry. Won't be going back.

Very classy restaurant.  Nicely decorated.  Very pleasant attentive staff.  This review is based on a one time dining experience; just so you know.  The food was good but not as flavorful as I had expected. Bland would be too strong a word. But knock-your-socks-off favorable would be inaccurate also.    The food, in my opinion, is very overpriced for what you get.  I had 'shaken beef' which consisted of mostly rice and onions and not a lot of beef even though it is advertised at 8 ounces.  That was $18.  Wife had 'firecracker shrimp on garlic noodles' which was very good but at $17, not really a value for the money spent.  The 'spring rolls' are very good and at $3 each, could be a full meal for a small appetite.  Beer is overpriced at $5 a draft.    I might go back to try one of the Banh Mi sandwiches to see if I get a little more value for my dollar.   Four stars for the classy, nicely decorated, friendly staff.  Three stars for the food.

This restaurant is gone from great in the beginning to very spotty in the new and expanded facility.     My wife and I were there on Sunday and found that the food was at best mediocre.  I ordered the RACK OF LAMB and it was over cooked and was mostly grizzle and fat.  My wife ordered the Salmon in a soy sauce served in a clay pot, and the salmon was RAW in the middle when she cut it open to eat it, the rice was not completely cooked and was a skimpy portion.  The only thing that was good was the SPRING ROLLS with PORK.    I found that since the restaurant was expanded the quality and service  is less than expected.  I was a early adopter of the restaurant and made it my home for Vietnamese cooking now I am beginning to look for a better Vietnamese restaurant.  Originally Dennis the owner was very concerned with the quality of the food.  Since the restaurant was expanded, the wait staff is less attentive and the food is now rushed out of the kitchen without supervision.

Superior experience. Wait time for a table, so we sat at the bar and met the greatest people, both regular customers and staff. Food was wonderful and staff was great. Will be our date night spot while we are in Surprise.

What a difference two years makes (since the last time I was in this place).  I've been there almost 10 times in the past 4 months. The service is friendly and earnest, but the wait staff are usually either overwhelmed or just simply in a fog!  The food, however, is OUT OF THIS WORLD! The spring rolls are my favorite and a fantastic deal during their mid-day happy hours.  Everything else I've tried was also excellent.    I honestly don't know what I was thinking when we first visited this place in 2011.  Perhaps they are under new management???  Finally, a place which is very reasonably priced, healthy, and delicious!
Been a regular for months. Ordered Chicken Fried Rice & Shrimp Spring Rolls. Very flavorful, delicious. Great food, staff is very polite & attentive. Nice cozy atmosphere. Zero complaints.

This place definitely serves authentic Vietnamese food.  It doesn't mean the food taste good.  What I tried:  Pho Dac Biet large bowl:  nice presentation but the broth was not very clear and a bit too sweet.  It doesn't have enough herb taste.  There were way too many meatballs and not enough of the other cooked meat.  The selection of Pho variation was limited.  No Pho Chin available.  I would not come here for their Pho.  Spring Rolls - Nem Nuong Cuon:  Decent all around.  Nothing bad to say but nothing spectacular to mention either.  Bun Cha Gio:  The egg rolls were nicely fried.  The taste was okay.  The vermicelli was a bit on the cold side and slightly too al dente for this dish.  They didn't stick together well which makes it difficult to pick up with the chopsticks.  I would prefer the noodles to be a bit warm.  This is probably one of the cleanliest Vietnamese restaurant you'll find in the valley.  Unfortunately, the food is just average.

Great food and great service here. I always come at lunch time so I'm not sure what it's like in the evening. The sizzling salmon is my favorite. I've tried about 10 things here and they were all very good.
One of the better asian fusion places in the west valley, and they just doubled in size. Great staff.

My husband and I loved Saigon Kitchen. Unfortunately, they were out of vegetarian broth (I'm a vegetarian), so a couple of menu items were out for me - pho included. Disappointing. Otherwise we had a great experience and were pleased with the fried rice, salad and salmon. Our waiter was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. We will return.

This place OVER CHARGED for their food Go to another restaurant They try to make it all fancy and fancy but the bill is outrageous  The food is not even that good I stopped going their cause it was no good

I find this restaurant in the higher-priced range. I ordered a large pho for pickup today. In the area I can get the same meal for a much lower price, almost half of what it is. The pickup took about 25-30 minutes.  .

This place has a nice selection of egg rolls and Bahn Mi. The mother doesnt speak english very well and had a hard time taking my order over the phone. When I arrived the daughter apologized and was very friendly. I ordered avocado egg rolls and chicken Bahn Mi. As I waited in the dining room I noticed a huge dead cockroach under the table. I alerted  them and she retrieved it and threw it away. I gave them the benefit of the doubt. This is NC and there are huge water bugs/roaches that may have come in from outside It happens. The avocado eggrolls were meh, and the Bahn Mi was really good. The bread was light, and airy, with some daikon, carrots and cilantro to as well. Nice balance. I am looking forward to trying some other things on the menu.

My boyfriend and I come here at least once a week (sometimes even twice a week...we're addicted!) and the food is amazing. We typically order shrimp and pork spring rolls and steak pho (side note: it's pronounced "fuh"). The staff is always incredibly friendly, and you'll typically get the same waiters/waitresses who will eventually get to know you. The owner, Dennis, is just about always on the premises and really takes care of his restaurant and socializes with customers quite often. I would definitely recommend this place... The price isn't too shabby either; typically about $30 (including tip) for us both.

I was extremely excited to try this restaurant as it is one of the few restaurants in this area of Surprise that isn't a big commercial chain. I ordered the beef clay pot and he ordered the curry shrimp. Both dishes come with soup & salad. The soup was a very flavorful broth which had a few scallions. It had a hint of licorice flavor & was salted perfectly. The salad was a good portion of green leaf lettuce and no other vegetables with a tasty sesame vinaigrette. When the main dishes arrived, we were very disappointed. His curry shrimp had the frozen cut carrots and peas tossed with a modest amount of shrimp and lots of potatoes. The curry was not creamy or unique in any way, I could make this from a box and that's exactly what it tasted like. My claypot of beef was supposed to come with vegetables and on top of a clay pot that is so hot that it makes the rice crispy. The rice wasn't crispy at all. The beef lacked any real flavor because all the sauce was on the rice. The dish only came with a few carrots and 3 slices of mushrooms. Lacked originality and value.
